between O

) O

But O

, O

computes O
the O
new O

bounds O

intersection O
between O
the O
old O
arithmetic O
bounds O
and O
the O
bounds O
resulting O
from O
the O
bitwise O
tristate O
representation O
. O

One O
of O
the O
bugs O
was O
introduced O
in O
4.9 SV
, O
the O
others O
were O
only O
introduced O
in O
4.14 SV
. O

This O
means O
that O
the O
output O
of O
e.g O
. O

The O
old O
code O
first O
mirrors O
the O
clearing O
of O
the O
high O

bits O
in O
the O
bitwise O
tristate O
representation O
, O
which O
is O
correct O
. O

entry_SYSCALL_64_fastpath+0x1e/0x86 O
[ O
10599.404036 O
] O

This O
is O
a O
kernel O
pointer O
leak O
. O

fixed O
by O
bpf O
: O
force O
strict O
alignment O
checks O
for O
stack O
pointers O
The O
verifier O
did O
not O
force O
strict O
alignment O
checks O
for O
stack O
pointers O
, O
but O
the O
tracking O
of O
stack O
spills O
relies O
on O
it O
; O
unaligned O
stack O
accesses O
can O
lead O
to O
corruption O
of O
spilled O
registers O
, O
which O
is O
exploitable O
. O

PoC O
for O
bpf O
: O
fix O
incorrect O
sign O
extension O
in O

( O
) O

is O
a O

that O

to O

address O
. O

bound O

could O
cause O
the O
new O
upper O
signed O
bound O
to O
be O
too O
low O
, O
leading O
to O
security O
issues O
. O

lockdep_sys_exit_thunk+0x16/0x2b O
[ O
117.274831 O
] O

Subject O
: O
Linux SN
> SV
=4.9 SV
: O
eBPF O
memory O
corruption O
bugs O

kernel/bpf/verifier.c O
in O
the O
Linux SN
kernel SN
through SV
4.14.8 SV
allows O
local O
users O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
memory O
corruption O
) O
or O
possibly O
have O
unspecified O
other O
impact O
by O
leveraging O
register O
truncation O
mishandling O
. O

Attackers O
can O
exploit O
the O
vulnerability O
by O
using O
the O
out O
of O
bounds O
access O
for O
unintended O
reads O
or O
writes O
potentially O
leading O
to O
code O
corruption O
, O
control-flow O
hijack O
, O
or O
an O
information O
leak O
attack O
. O

This O
vulnerability O
is O
an O
instance O
of O
a O
type O
confusion O
overflow O
vulnerability O
. O

The O
vulnerability O
leads O
to O
an O
out O
of O
bounds O
memory O
access O
. O

An O
issue O
was O
discovered O
in O
Adobe SN
Acrobat SN
and SN
Reader SN
: O
2017.012.20098 SV
and SV
earlier SV
versions SV
, O
2017.011.30066 SV
and SV
earlier SV
versions SV
, O
2015.006.30355 SV
and SV
earlier SV
versions SV
, O
and SV
11.0.22 SV
and SV
earlier SV
versions SV
. O

This O
vulnerability O
is O
an O
instance O
of O
an O
out O
of O
bounds O
read O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
MakeAccesible O
plugin O
, O
when O
handling O
font O
data O
. O

Attackers O
can O
exploit O
the O
vulnerability O
by O
using O
the O
out O
of O
bounds O
access O
for O
unintended O
reads O
, O
writes O
, O
or O
frees O
, O
potentially O
leading O
to O
code O
corruption O
, O
control-flow O
hijack O
, O
or O
an O
information O
leak O
attack O
. O

It O
causes O
an O
out O
of O
bounds O
memory O
access O
, O
which O
sometimes O
triggers O
an O
access O
violation O
exception O
. O

Privilege O
escalation O
and O
information O
leaks O
can O
not O
be O
ruled O
out O
. O

Grant O
copying O
code O
made O
an O
implication O
that O
any O
grant O
pin O
would O
be O
accompanied O
by O
a O
suitable O
page O
reference O
. O

When O
such O
a O
grant O
copy O
operation O
is O
being O
done O
on O
a O
grant O
of O
a O
dying O
domain O
, O
the O
assumption O
turns O
out O
wrong O
. O

Other O
portions O
of O
code O
, O
however O
, O
did O
not O
match O
up O
with O
that O
assumption O
. O

An O
issue O
was O
discovered O
in O
Xen SN
through SV
4.9.x SV
. O

A O
malicious O
guest O
administrator O
can O
cause O
hypervisor O
memory O
corruption O
, O
most O
likely O
resulting O
in O
host O
crash O
and O
a O
Denial O
of O
Service O
. O

( O
Note O
: O
this O
during-embargo O
deployment O
notice O
is O
retained O
in O
post-embargo O
publicly O
released O
Xen O
Project O
advisories O
, O
even O
though O
it O
is O
then O
no O
longer O
applicable O
. O

Predisclosure O
list O
members O
who O
wish O
to O
deploy O
significantly O
different O
patches O
and/or O
mitigations O
, O
please O
contact O
the O
Xen O
Project O
Security O
Team O
. O

RESOLUTION O
Applying O
the O
appropriate O
attached O
patch O
resolves O
this O
issue O
. O

Both O
x86 SV
and O
ARM O
are O
vulnerable O
, O
and O
on O
x86 SV
both O
PV O
and O
HVM O
guests O
can O
trigger O
the O
vulnerability O
. O

ISSUE O
DESCRIPTION O
Grant O
copying O
code O
made O
an O
implication O
that O
any O
grant O
pin O
would O
be O
accompanied O
by O
a O
suitable O
page O
reference O
. O

Public O
release O
. O

CREDITS O
This O
issue O
was O
discovered O
by O
Pawel O
Wieczorkiewicz O
of O
Amazon O
. O

Fix O
grammar O
typo O
. O

This O
is O
to O
enable O
the O
community O
to O
have O
oversight O
of O
the O
Xen O
Project O
Security O
Team O
decisionmaking O
. O
) O

IMPACT O
A O
malicious O
guest O
administrator O
can O
cause O
hypervisor O
memory O
corruption O
, O
most O
likely O
resulting O
in O
host O
crash O
and O
a O
Denial O
of O
Service O
. O

We O
now O
once O
again O
think O
that O
only O
Xen SN
4.2 SV
and SV
newer SV
are O
vulnerable O
. O

Xen O
versions O
4.1 O
and O
earlier O
are O
not O
vulnerable O
. O

DEPLOYMENT O
DURING O
EMBARGO O
Deployment O
of O
the O
patches O
and/or O
mitigations O
described O
above O
( O
or O
others O
which O
are O
substantially O
similar O
) O
is O
permitted O
during O
the O
embargo O
, O
even O
on O
public-facing O
systems O
with O
untrusted O
guest O
users O
and O
administrators O
. O

But O
: O
Distribution O
of O
updated O
software O
is O
prohibited O
( O
except O
to O
other O
members O
of O
the O
predisclosure O
list O
) O
. O

VULNERABLE O
SYSTEMS O
Xen SN
versions O
from SV
4.2 SV
onwards SV
are O
vulnerable O
. O

MITIGATION O
Running O
only O
guests O
without O
para-virtual O
drivers O
, O
and O
known O
not O
to O
issue O
grant O
table O
operations O
can O
avoid O
the O
vulnerability O
. O

Subject O
: O
Xen O
Security O
Advisory O
236 O
( O
CVE-2017-15597 O
) O
- O
pin O
count O
page O
reference O
race O
in O
grant O
table O
code O

In O
Poppler SN
0.59.0 SV
, O
memory O
corruption O

The O
code O

There O

I O

was O

could O
exist O
. O

There O
is O
quite O
easily O
reached O
race O
condition O
between O

( O
) O
and O

( O
) O
. O

When O

( O

) O

: O

only O
. O

So O
if O
other O

will O

macOS SN
before SV
10.12.5 SV
is O
affected O
. O

The O
issue O
involves O
the O
Accessibility O
Framework O
component O
. O

This O
poc O
just O
crashes O
the O
Dock O
process O
though O
. O

Amusingly O
this O
opensource O
facebook O
code O
on O
github O
contains O
a O
workaround O
for O
a O
memory O
safety O
issue O
in O
cfAttributedStringUnserialize O
: O
on O
MacOS SN
10.12.3 SV
( O
16D32 SV
) O
ianbeer O
if O
0 O
MacOS O
local O
EoP O
due O
to O
lack O
of O
bounds O
checking O
in O
HIServices O
custom O
CFObject O
serialization O
HIServices.framework O
is O
used O
by O
a O
handful O
of O
deamons O
and O
implements O
its O
own O
CFObject O
serialization O
mechanism O
. O

This O
poc O
talks O
to O
the O
com.apple.dock.server O
service O
hosted O
by O
the O
Dock O
process O
. O

com.apple.uninstalld O
is O
a O
client O
of O
the O
Dock O
and O
runs O
as O
root O
so O
by O
first O
exploiting O
this O
bug O
to O
gain O
code O
execution O
as O
the O
Dock O
process O
, O
we O
could O
trigger O
the O
same O
bug O
in O
uninstalld O
when O
it O
parses O
a O
reply O
from O
the O
dock O
and O
get O
code O
execution O
as O
root O
. O

The O
first O
method O
, O
cfStringUnserialize O
, O
trusts O
the O
length O
field O
in O
the O
serialized O
representation O
and O
uses O
that O
to O
byte-swap O
the O
string O
without O
any O
bounds O
checking O
leading O
to O
memory O
corruption O
. O

I O
would O
guess O
that O
all O
the O
other O
unserialization O
methods O
should O
also O
be O
closely O
examined O
. O

Apple O
macOS O
- O
Lack O
of O
Bounds O
Checking O
in O
HIServices O
Custom O
CFObject O
Serialization O
Local O
Privilege O
Escalation O

Buffer O
Overflow O
in O
Quest O
One O
Identity O
Privilege O
Manager O
for O
Unix SN
before SV
6.0.0.061 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
obtain O
full O
access O
to O
the O
policy O
server O
via O
an O
ACT_ALERT_EVENT O
request O
that O
causes O
memory O
corruption O
in O
the O
pmmasterd O
daemon O
. O

This O
module O
only O
works O
against O
version O
< SV
6.0.0-27 SV
. O

Versions O
up SV
to SV
6.0.0-50 SV
are O
also O
vulnerable O
, O
but O
not O
supported O
by O
this O
module O
( O
a O
stack O
cookie O
bypass O
is O
required O
) O
. O

NOTE O
: O
To O
use O
this O
module O
it O
is O
required O
to O
be O
able O
to O
bind O
a O
privileged O
port O
( O
< O
=1024 O
) O
as O
the O
server O
refuses O
connections O
coming O
from O
unprivileged O
ports O
, O
which O
in O
most O
situations O
means O
that O
root O
privileges O
are O
required O
. O

( O
target O
[ O
: O
check O
] O
, O
true O
) O
fail_with O
( O
Failure O
: O
:NoTarget O
, O
Invalid O
target O
specified O
) O
end O
send O
( O
target O
[ O
: O
check O
] O
) O
end O
def O
exploit O
unless O
respond_to O

The O
vulnerability O
exists O
in O
the O
pmmasterd O
daemon O
, O
and O
can O
only O
triggered O
when O
the O
host O
has O
been O
configured O
as O
a O
policy O
server O
( O
Privilege O
Manager O
for O
Unix O
or O
Quest O
Sudo O
Plugin O
) O
. O

sends O
a O
crashing O
request O
, O
if O
the O
socket O
dies O
, O
or O
the O
output O
is O
partial O
it O
assumes O
the O
target O
has O
crashed O
. O

A O
buffer O
overflow O
condition O
exists O
when O
handling O
requests O
of O
type O
ACT_ALERT_EVENT O
, O
where O
the O
size O
of O
a O
memcpy O
can O
be O
controlled O
by O
the O
attacker O
. O

Although O
the O
daemon O
spawns O
a O
new O
process O
for O
each O
connection O
, O
the O
segfault O
will O
appear O
on O
syslog O
def O
check O
unless O
respond_to O

- O

( O

) O

. O

( O

ASAN O
log O
follows O
. O

It O
appears O
this O
behavior O
is O
caused O
by O
the O
fact O
that O

inspector O

features O

are O

default O
through O

. O

The O
PoC O
also O
crashes O

on O
Mac O
, O
but O
only O
if O

PoC O
is O
run O
while O

Error O
Console O
are O
enabled O
. O

- O
Type O
Confusion O
in O
RenderBox O
with O
Accessibility O
Enabled O

In O
WebKit O
, O
resetting O
the O
output O
element O
is O
equivalent O
to O
setting O
its O

, O
which O
causes O
all O
of O
its O
child O
elements O
( O
if O

) O
to O
be O
removed O
from O
the O

. O

: O

Analysis O
: O
The O
bug O
is O
in O
HTMLFormElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
function O
, O
specifically O
in O
this O
part O
: O
for O
( O
auto O
& O
associatedElement O
: O
m_associatedElements O
) O
{ O
if O
( O
is O
< O
HTMLFormControlElement O
> O
( O
associatedElement O
) O
) O
downcast O
< O
HTMLFormControlElement O
> O
( O
associatedElement O
) O
.reset O
( O
) O
; O
} O
The O
issue O
is O
that O
while O
m_associatedElements O
vector O
is O
being O
iterated O
, O
its O
content O
can O
change O
( O
HTMLFormControlElement O
being O
added O
or O
removed O
from O
it O
) O
. O

Using O
this O
trick O
we O
can O
remove O
elements O
from O
m_associatedElements O
while O
it O
is O
being O
iterated O
. O

I O
did O
this O
by O
adding O
DOMSubtreeModified O
event O
listener O
to O
the O
output O
element O
, O
so O
that O
when O
the O
output O
element O
gets O
reset O
, O
the O
event O
triggers O
and O
in O
the O
event O
hanlder O
newly O
created O
input O
elements O
are O
added O
to O
the O
form O
. O

log O
: O

, O

Since O
HTMLFormControlElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
is O
a O
virtual O
function O
, O
this O
can O
easily O
lead O
to O
code O
execution O
. O

The O
loop O
inside O
HTMLFormElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
continues O
to O
iterate O
over O
now O
deleted O
buffer O
, O
causing O
the O
use-after O
free O
condition O
. O

This O
causes O
the O
vector O
buffer O
to O
be O
reallocated O
to O
accommodate O
the O
new O
form O
elements O
. O

However O
, O
this O
by O
itself O
is O
not O
sufficient O
to O
exploit O
this O
issue O
as O
m_associatedElements.remove O
( O
index O
) O
( O
called O
from O
HTMLFormElement O
: O
:removeFormElement O
( O
) O
) O
won O
t O
actually O
reallocate O
the O
vector O
buffer O
, O
it O
will O
only O
decrease O
vector O
m_size O
and O
the O
vector O
elements O
after O
m_size O
will O
still O
point O
to O
the O
( O
former O
) O
form O
members O
. O

Also O
note O
that O
the O
size O
of O
the O
freed O
buffer O
can O
be O
chosen O
by O
the O
attacker O
) O
, O
subsequent O
iterations O
over O
m_associatedElements O
will O
cause O
HTMLFormControlElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
method O
to O
be O
called O
on O
the O
attacker-controlled O
pointer O
. O

Normally O
HTMLFormControlElement.reset O
( O
) O
doesn O
t O
change O
the O
DOM O
, O
but O
there O
is O
one O
exception O
to O
this O
: O
The O
output O
element O
. O

So O
instead O
of O
removing O
elements O
from O
the O
m_associatedElements O
vector O
, O
I O
instead O
add O
elements O
to O
it O
while O
it O
is O
being O
iterated O
. O

( O
It O
might O
be O
possible O
to O
force O
the O
removed O
form O
members O
to O
be O
deleted O
but O
I O
haven O
t O
experimented O
with O
this O
) O
. O

If O
an O
attacker O
manages O
to O
reclaim O
the O
space O
of O
the O
freed O
buffer O
and O
fill O
it O
with O
attacker-controlled O
data O
( O
there O
is O
plenty O
of O
opportunity O
to O
do O
this O
inside O
the O
DOMSubtreeModified O
event O
handler O
. O

Apple O
WebKit O
- O
HTMLFormElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
Use-After O
Free O

The O
issue O
involves O
the O
Graphics O
Drivers O
component O
. O

macOS SN
before SV
10.12.3 SV
is O
affected O
. O

Such O
situation O
can O
lead O
to O
a O
buffer O
overrun O
, O
resulting O
in O
a O
heap O
memory O
corruption O
or O
an O
information O
disclosure O
from O
the O
heap O
. O

. O

. O

The O

: O
:WriteEMF O
function O
( O
adddress O
0x100518F0 O
) O

over O

place O
through O
a O

device O
, O

, O

. O

This O
report O
addresses O
a O

of O
bugs O
in O
the O
handling O
of O

images O
embedded O
in O

It O
was O

that O
some O
of O

can O
be O

to O

( O

) O

) O
First O

are O
reported O
before O

exception O
handling O
. O

Some O

in O

process O

: O

. O

in O

during O

processing O
. O

issue O
is O
rated O
as O
High O
due O
to O
the O
possibility O
of O
remote O
code O
execution O
within O
the O
context O
of O
the O
gallery O
process O
. O

the O
issue O
( O
APSB16-26 O

: O
Advisory O
released O
by O
COSIG O
; O
3 O
) O
Technical O
details O
The O
vulnerability O
allows O
a O
remote O
attacker O
to O
execute O
malicious O
code O
or O
access O
to O
part O
of O
dynamically O
allocated O
memory O
using O
a O
user O
interaction O
that O
opens O
a O
specially O
crafted O
PDF O
file O
containing O
an O
invalid O
font O
( O
.ttf O
) O
including O
invalid O
data O
. O

The O
asn1_get_length_der O
function O
in O
decoding.c O
in O
GNU SN
Libtasn1 SN
before SV
2.12 SV
, O
as O
used O
in O
GnuTLS SN
before SV
3.0.16 SV
and O
other O
products O
, O
does O
not O
properly O
handle O
certain O
large O
length O
values O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
heap O
memory O
corruption O
and O
application O
crash O
) O
or O
possibly O
have O
unspecified O
other O
impact O
via O
a O
crafted O
ASN.1 O
structure O
. O

Added O
self O
check O
to O
detect O
the O
problem O
, O
see O
tests/Test_overflow.c O
. O

Instead O
, O
we O
made O
asn1_get_length_der O
return O
an O
error O
code O
when O
the O
situation O
occured O
, O
to O
protect O
callers O
. O

Further O
issue O
details O
from O
Simon O
Josefsson O
: O
I O
want O
to O
mention O
that O
there O
were O
no O
security O
problem O
in O
the O
asn1_get_length_der O
function O
. O

It O
was O
working O
properly O
and O
as O
documented O
before O
. O

The O
security O
problem O
was O
the O
callers O
not O
checking O
that O
the O
returned O
values O
were O
reasonable O
, O
i.e. O
, O
that O
the O
output O
length O
was O
less O
than O
or O
equal O
to O
the O
total O
length O
of O
the O
buffer O
. O

This O
problem O
can O
lead O
to O
at O
least O
remotely O
triggered O
crashes O
, O
see O
further O
analysis O
on O
the O
libtasn1 O
mailing O
list O
. O

However O
, O
fixing O
all O
callers O
of O
this O
function O
would O
be O
a O
huge O
amount O
of O
work O
. O

It O
appears O
like O
GnuTLS O
is O
affected O
as O
well O
( O
but O
probably O
does O
not O
need O
a O
separate O
CVE O
at O
this O
point O
) O
: O
References O
Release O
announcement O
: O
Small O
analysis O
+ O
patch O
: O
Red O
Hat O
bug O
: O
Thanks O
and O
kind O
regards O
, O
Stefan O
Cornelius O
Red O
Hat O
Security O
Response O
Team O

However O
, O
we O
are O
hoping O
that O
is O
not O
in O
any O
significant O
use O
, O
and O
that O
overall O
security O
will O
be O
improved O
by O
having O
the O
function O
sanity O
check O
its O
output O
rather O
than O
letting O
the O
caller O
do O
that O
. O

This O
was O
a O
judgement O
call O
. O

Subject O
: O
CVE O
request O
: O
libtasn1 O
asn1_get_length_der O
( O
) O
DER O
decoding O
issue O

This O
fix O
could O
be O
the O
wrong O
thing O
if O
some O
code O
out O
there O
calls O
the O
function O
with O
a O
der_len O
parameter O
that O
is O
smaller O
than O
the O
entire O
DER O
structure O
length O
. O

It O
appears O
like O
GnuTLS O
is O
affected O
as O
well O
( O
but O
probably O
does O
not O
need O
a O
separate O
CVE O
at O
this O
point O
) O
: O
References O
Release O
announcement O
: O
Small O
analysis O
+ O
patch O
: O
Red O
Hat O
bug O
: O
Thanks O
and O
kind O
regards O
, O
Please O
use O
CVE-2012-1569 O
for O
this O
issue O
. O

: O

: O

without O
a O
closing O
> O
in O
an O

file O
, O
which O
triggers O
heap O
memory O
corruption O
, O
as O
demonstrated O
using O

Failed O

will O
cause O
denial-of-service O
conditions O
. O

may O

this O
issue O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
in O
the O
context O
of O
the O
application O
. O

to O
open O

containing O

subtitles O
with O
the O
vulnerable O
application O
. O

Vulnerability O
Details O
: O
This O

This O
pointer O
is O

Check O
Point O
Software O
Technologies O
- O
Vulnerability O
Discovery O
Team O
( O
VDT O
) O
Memory O
corruption O
when O
Adobe O
Shockwave O
Player O
parses O
.dir O
media O
file O
( O
duplicated O
LCSM O
entries O
in O
mmap O
record O
) O
CVE-2010-4089 O
INTRODUCTION O
Adobe O
Shockwave O
Player O
is O
the O
Adobe O
plugin O
to O
many O
different O
browsers O
to O
view O
rich-media O
content O
on O
the O
web O
including O
animations O
, O
interactive O
presentations O
, O
and O
online O
entertainment O
. O

Duplicated O
LCSM O
entries O
causes O
memory O
corruption O
as O
shown O
in O
PoC O
( O
repro15.dir O
) O
. O

mmap O
records O
contains O
offsets O
and O
lengths O
of O
all O
other O
records O
. O

second O
chance O
! O
! O
! O
) O

Missing O
image O
name O
, O
possible O
paged-out O
or O
corrupt O
data O
. O

was O

Best O

- O

disclosure O
2 O
. O

02/13/2008 O
- O
Coordinated O
disclosure O
Regards O
, O
Ruben O
. O

However O
, O
its O
own O
Device O
DeviceExtension O
is O
not O
correclty O
initialized O
so O
any O
logged O
user O
could O
force O
the O
kernel O
to O
operate O
with O
user-mode O
controlled O
memory O
just O
by O
direclty O
issuing O
a O
special O
request O
to O
the O
driver O
device O
. O

Even O
Guest O
users O
can O
elevate O
privileges O
to O
SYSTEM O
. O

This O
could O
lead O
to O
remote O
arbitrary O
code O
execution O
in O
the O
context O
of O
the O
user O
who O
started O
the O
application O
. O

The O
driver O
affected O
filters O
certain O
devices O
, O
enabling O
pass-through O
filtering O
. O

Fortinet O
FortiClient O
Local O
Privilege O
Escalation O
. O

Fortinet O
Endpoint O
Solution O
For O
Enterprise O
, O
FortiClient O
is O
prone O
to O
a O
local O

due O
to O

improper O
device O

[ O
MajorSecurity O
] O
ActualAnalyzer O
- O
Remote O
File O
Include O
Vulnerability O
Software O
: O
ActualAnalyzer O
Type O
: O
Remote O
File O
Include O
Vulnerability O
Date O
: O
April O
, O
19th O
2006 O

Description O
: O
ActualAnalyzer O
is O
a O
powerful O
statistics-gathering O
and O
analysis O
tool O
for O
monitoring O
web O
site O
traffic O
. O

Exploitation O
: O
Post O
data O
: O
rf= O

It O
is O
equally O
effective O
for O
sites O
with O
low O
and O
high O
volumes O
of O
traffic O
and O
provides O
a O
wealth O
of O
comparative O
and O
analytical O
information O
. O

Solution O
: O
Edit O
the O
source O
code O
to O
ensure O
that O

) O

HTTP O
Response O
Splitting O
enables O
an O
attacker O
to O
alter O
the O
HTTP O
response O
header O
structure O
which O
can O
leads O
to O
various O
range O
of O
attacks O
such O
as O
web O
cache O
poisoning O
, O
temporary O
defacement O
, O
hijacking O
pages O
or O
cross-site O
scripting O
( O
XSS O
) O
. O

This O
happens O
since O
the O
user O
input O
is O
injected O
into O
the O
value O
section O
of O
http O
header O
without O
properly O
escaping/removing O
CRLF O
characters O
which O
can O
leads O
to O
two O
HTTP O
responses O
instead O
of O
one O
response O
. O

Vendor O
: O
Shop-Script O
( O
a O
division O
of O
WebAsyst O
LLC O
) O
Application O
: O
Shop-Script O
( O
) O
I. O
Descriptions O
: O
Shop-Script O
is O
a O
PHP O
based O
shopping O
cart O
. O

Multiple O
links O
of O
shop-script O
are O
vulnerable O
to O
a O
new O
form O
of O
application O
attack O
technique O
called O
HTTP O
Response O
splitting O
( O
aka O
CRLF O
Injection O
) O
. O

V. O
Reference O
: O
VI O
. O

Credits O
: O

) O

are O

. O

More O

CVE-2006-7243 O
like O
issues O
. O

In O

, O
that O
could O
lead O
to O
security O
failure O
for O

access O
controls O
if O

This O
meant O
that O
any O
guest O
can O
reconfigure O
these O
settings O
for O
the O
entire O
system O
. O

ISSUE O
DESCRIPTION O
When O
running O
on O
an O
ARM O
platform O
Xen O
was O
not O
context O
switching O
the O
CNTKCTL_EL1 O
register O
, O
which O
is O
used O
by O
the O
guest O
kernel O
to O
control O
access O
by O
userspace O
processes O
to O
the O
hardware O
timers O
. O

Subject O
: O
Xen O
Security O
Advisory O
91 O
- O
Hardware O
timer O
context O
is O
not O
properly O
context O
switched O
on O
ARM O
BEGIN O
PGP O
SIGNED O
MESSAGE O
Hash O
: O
SHA1 O
Xen O
Security O
Advisory O
XSA-91 O
version O
2 O
Hardware O
timer O
context O
is O
not O
properly O
context O
switched O
on O
ARM O
UPDATES O
IN O
VERSION O
2 O
Public O
release O
. O

x86 O
systems O
are O
not O
vulnerable O
. O

RESOLUTION O
Applying O
the O
appropriate O
attached O
patch O
resolves O
this O
issue O
. O

IMPACT O
A O
malicious O
guest O
kernel O
can O
reconfigure O
CNTKCTL_EL1 O
to O
block O
userspace O
access O
to O
the O
timer O
hardware O
for O
all O
domains O
, O
including O
control O
domains O
. O

Depending O
on O
the O
other O
guest O
kernels O
in O
use O
this O
may O
cause O
an O
unexpected O
exception O
in O
those O
guests O
which O
may O
lead O
to O
a O
kernel O
crash O
and O
therefore O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
. O

64-bit O
ARM O
Linux O
is O
known O
to O
be O
susceptible O
to O
crashing O
in O
this O
way O
. O

This O
can O
allow O
user O
processes O
to O
reprogram O
timer O
interrupts O
and O
therefore O
lead O
to O
unexpected O
behaviour O
, O
potentially O
up O
to O
and O
including O
crashing O
the O
guest O
. O

MITIGATION O
None O
. O

CREDITS O
Chen O
Baozi O
discovered O
this O
issue O
as O
a O
bug O
which O
was O
then O
diagnosed O
by O
Julien O
Grall O
. O

VULNERABLE O
SYSTEMS O
Both O
32- O
and O
64-bit O
ARM O
systems O
are O
vulnerable O
from O
Xen SN
4.4 SV
onwards SV
. O

Userspace O
processes O
will O
also O
be O
able O
to O
read O
the O
current O

The O
SFIAB O

Description O
: O
The O
Science O
Fair O
in O
a O
Box O
( O
SFIAB O
) O
project O
provides O
regions O
hosting O
a O
science O
fair O
with O
a O
complete O
and O
comprehensive O
package O
that O
can O
be O
used O

in O

the O

. O

All O

in O
SFIAB O
is O
internationalized O
to O
allow O
the O
use O
of O
the O
system O
in O
any O
language O
. O

SFIAB O
is O
developed O
using O
PHP O
, O
with O
MySQL O
as O
the O
backend O
database O
. O

Language O
Packs O
will O
be O
available O
in O
other O
language O
once O
translations O
are O
complete O
. O

The O
SFIAB O
provides O
a O
web O
based O
application O
to O
facilitate O
all O
areas O
of O
running O
a O
science O
fair O
such O
as O

registration O
for O
the O
participants O
, O
judges O
, O
sponsor O
management O
, O
judge O
scheduling O
and O
awards O
management O
. O

SFIAB O
is O
the O
most O
advanced O
, O
most O

Science O
Fair O

in O
the O
world O
, O
and O

many O

countries O
! O

< SV

- O

Hi O
, O
we O
are O
a O
group O
of O
Stanford O
researchers O
and O
we O
have O
recently O
developed O
an O
automated O
tool O
for O
detecting O
injection O
vulnerabilities O
in O
PHP O
. O

into O

We O
decided O
not O
to O
publish O
exploits O
for O
the O
interest O
of O
web O
sites O
that O
have O
deployed O
such O

missing O

Vulnerability O
Information O
Class O
: O
Storing O
Passwords O
in O
a O
Recoverable O
Format O
[ O
CWE-257 O
] O
Impact O
: O
Information O
leak O
Remotely O
Exploitable O
: O
No O
Locally O
Exploitable O
: O
Yes O
CVE O
Name O
: O
CVE-pending-assignment O
3 O
. O

Sensitive O
values O
, O
such O
as O
the O
proxy O
username O
and O
password O
if O
set O
, O
are O
stored O
encrypted O
using O
a O
fixed O
static O
key O
. O

imports O
from O
sys O

platform O
from O
struct O

pack O
, O
unpack O
from O
optparse O
import O
OptionParser O
from O
subprocess O
import O

import O

: O
from O
Crypto.Cipher O
import O
AES O
except O
ImportError O
: O
AES O
= O
None O
Java O
serialization O
decoding O
. O

Report O
Timeline O
2016-02-05 O
: O
Core O
Security O
sent O
an O
initial O
notification O
to O
SAP O
. O

They O
stated O
that O
March O
7th O
was O
too O
short O
of O
a O
notice O
to O
work O
on O
the O
fix O
, O
release O
fix O
after O
quality O
tests O
and O
for O
customers O
to O
consume O
it O
. O

This O
program O
is O
free O
software O
; O
you O
can O
redistribute O
it O
and/or O
modify O
it O
under O
the O
terms O
of O
the O
GNU O
General O
Public O
License O
as O
published O
by O
the O
Free O
Software O
Foundation O
; O
either O
version O
2 O
of O
the O
License O
, O
or O
( O
at O
your O
option O
) O
any O
later O
version O
. O

2016-03-02 O
: O
SAP O
informed O
Core O
Security O
they O
were O
on O
track O
with O
their O
correction O
for O
the O
8 O
of O
March O
. O

However O
, O
other O
sensitive O
values O
, O
such O
as O
the O
user O
proxy O
password O
are O
stored O
encrypted O
. O

Regarding O
crediting O
, O
we O
informed O
them O
Martin O
Gallo O
should O
be O
noted O
as O
credit O
recipient O
. O

of O
this O
advisory O
was O
coordinated O
by O
Joaqu O
xc3 O
x83 O
xc2 O
xadn O

xc3 O
x83 O
xc2 O

from O
Core O
Advisories O

. O

[ O
CORE-2016-0004 O
] O
- O
SAP O
Download O
Manager O
Password O
Weak O
Encryption O

5.3 SV
, O
6.1 SV

7.1 SV

do O
not O

to O

, O

makes O
it O

for O

attackers O
to O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
via O
unspecified O
vectors O
. O

vectors O
. O

Apache SN
CloudStack SN
before SV
4.5.2 SV
might O
allow O
remote O

administrators O
to O
obtain O
sensitive O
password O
information O
for O

of O
virtual O
machines O
via O
unspecified O
vectors O
related O
to O
API O
calls O
. O

BEGIN O
PGP O
SIGNATURE O
Version O
: O
GnuPG O
v1 O

Mitigation O
: O
Users O
of O
Apache O
CloudStack O
should O
update O
to O
at O
least O
4.5.2 O
or O
4.6.0 O
. O

Vendors O
: O
The O
Apache O
Software O
Foundation O
Citrix O
, O
Inc O
. O

Under O
certain O
circumstances O
, O
the O
results O
of O
certain O
API O
calls O
may O
expose O
the O
root O
password O
for O
a O
virtual O
machine O
related O
to O
an O
API O
call O
. O

Additionally O
ensure O
non-administrative O
users O
do O
not O
have O
root O
or O
domain-administrator O
level O
accounts O
. O

PGP O

: O

: O

Exposure O

and SN

through SV

send O
the O

credentials O
for O
a O

connection O

, O

attackers O
to O

sensitive O
information O
via O
unspecified O
vectors O
. O

B120/37 SV

The O

function O
in O
fs/cifs/file.c O
in O
the O
Linux SN
kernel SN
through SV

does O
not O
properly O

operations O
that O
copy O

than O

of O

via O
a O

system O
call O
with O
a O
crafted O
pointer O
. O

Subject O
: O
Wrong O
affected O
version O
in O
the O
CVE-2012-4511 O

Mozilla SN
Firefox SN
before SV
17.0 SV
, O
Thunderbird SN
before SV
17.0 SV
, O
and O
SeaMonkey SN
before SV
2.14 SV
assign O
the O
system O
principal O
, O
rather O
than O
the O
sandbox O
principal O
, O
to O
XMLHttpRequest O
objects O
created O
in O
sandboxes O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
conduct O
cross-site O
request O
forgery O
( O
CSRF O
) O
attacks O
or O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
by O
leveraging O
a O
sandboxed O
add-on O
. O

Performance SN
Co-Pilot SN
( O
PCP SN
) O
before SV
3.6.5 SV
exports O
some O
of O
the O
/proc O
file O
system O
, O
which O
allows O
attackers O
to O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
such O
as O
proc/pid/maps O
and O
command O
line O
arguments O
. O

These O
issues O
have O
been O
addressed O
in O
pcp-3.6.5 O
. O

Opera SN
before SV
11.62 SV
on O
UNIX O
uses O
world-readable O
permissions O
for O
temporary O
files O
during O
printing O
, O
which O
allows O
local O
users O
to O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
by O
reading O
these O
files O
. O

The O
chat O
functionality O
in O
Moodle SN
2.0.x SV
before SV
2.0.5 SV
and SV
2.1.x SV
before SV
2.1.2 SV
allows O
remote O
authenticated O
users O
to O
discover O
the O
name O
of O
any O
user O
via O
a O
beep O
operation O
. O

1.0.3 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
via O
a O
direct O
request O
to O
a O
.php O
file O
, O
which O
reveals O
the O
installation O
path O
in O
an O
error O
message O
, O
as O
demonstrated O
by O
templates/hycus_template/template.php O
. O

Disclosure O
issue O
in O

! O

Joomla O
does O
have O
too O
many O
vulnerabilities O
. O

I O

to O

email O
as O

that O

. O

: O

( O

: O

Joomla SN
prior SV
to SV

contains O
a O

that O
may O

to O

information O

. O

Subject O
: O
Re O
: O
CVE O
request O
: O
Joomla O
unspecified O
information O
disclosure O
vulnerability O
Path O
Disclosure O
should O
better O
be O
regarded O
as O
more O
closely O
related O
to O
server-side O
issue O
. O

It O
may O
be O
too O

or O
unnecessary O
to O
create O
one O
path O
disclosure O
issue O
per O
CVE O
. O

this O
one O

a O
2010 O
or O
2011 O
identifier O

Subject O
: O
Re O
: O
CVE O
request O
: O
Joomla O
unspecified O
information O
disclosure O
vulnerability O

CFNetwork O
in O
Apple SN
Mac SN
OS SN
X SN
10.7.x SV
before SV
10.7.3 SV
does O
not O
properly O
construct O
request O
headers O
during O
parsing O
of O
URLs O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
via O
a O
malformed O
URL O
. O

Mahara SN
before SV
1.3.6 SV
does O
not O
properly O
restrict O
the O
data O
in O
responses O
to O
AJAX O
calls O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
authenticated O
users O
to O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
via O
a O
request O
associated O
with O
( O
1 O
) O
blocktype/myfriends/myfriends.json.php O
, O
( O
2 O
) O
json/usersearch.php O
, O
( O
3 O
) O
group/membersearchresults.json.php O
, O
or O
( O
4 O
) O
json/friendsearch.php O
, O
as O
demonstrated O
by O
information O
about O
friends O
and O
e-mail O
addresses O
. O

The O
drm_ioctl O
function O
in O
drivers/gpu/drm/drm_drv.c O
in O
the O
Direct O
Rendering O
Manager O
( O
DRM O
) O
subsystem O
in O
the O
Linux SN
kernel SN
before SV
2.6.27.53 SV
, O
2.6.32.x SV
before SV
2.6.32.21 SV
, O
2.6.34.x SV
before SV
2.6.34.6 SV
, O
and SV
2.6.35.x SV
before SV
2.6.35.4 SV
allows O
local O
users O
to O
obtain O
potentially O
sensitive O
information O
from O
kernel O
memory O
by O
requesting O
a O
large O
memory-allocation O
amount O
. O

Joomla SN
before SV
1.5.15 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
read O
an O
extension O
XML O
file O
, O
and O
thereby O
obtain O
the O
extension O
version O
number O
, O
via O
a O
direct O
request O
. O

The O
Migration O
in O
IBM SN
WebSphere SN
Application SN
Server SN
( O
WAS SN
) O
6.1 SV
before SV

Secu SN

[ O
Technical O
description O
: O

[ O
Synopsis O
: O

of O

to O

reading O
passwords O

2 O
) O

Based O
on O
internal O
markings O
, O
my O
Motorola O

is O
a O
model O
U6 O
( O

) O

satisfaction O
is O

for O

so O
they O
do O
what O
is O
necessary O
to O
ensure O
that O
they O

a O
quality O
experience O
. O

DMA O
[ O
2006-0321a O
] O
- O
Motorola O
P2K O
Platform O
setpath O
( O
) O
overflow O
and O
Blueline O
attack O

The O
web O
management O
interface O
in O
3Com SN
TippingPoint SN
SMS SN
Server SN
before SV
2.2.1.4478 SV
does O
not O
restrict O
access O
to O
certain O
directories O
, O
which O
might O
allow O
remote O
attackers O
to O
obtain O
potentially O
sensitive O
information O
such O
as O
configuration O
settings O
. O

Explicit O
details O
regarding O
the O
specifics O
of O
the O
vulnerability O
are O
not O
exposed O
to O
any O
parties O
until O
an O
official O
vendor O
patch O
is O
publicly O
available O
. O

Affected O
Products O
: O
TippingPoint O
SMS O
Server O
Vulnerability O
Details O
: O
This O
vulnerability O
may O
allow O
attackers O
to O
access O
sensitive O
information O
from O
vulnerable O
TippingPoint O
SMS O
servers O
. O

Researchers O
interested O
in O
getting O
paid O
for O
their O
security O
research O
through O
the O
ZDI O
can O
find O
more O
information O
and O
sign-up O
at O
: O
The O
ZDI O
is O
unique O
in O
how O
the O
acquired O
vulnerability O
information O
is O
used O
. O

The O
specific O
flaw O
exists O
within O
the O
web O
management O
interface O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
with O
the O
altruistic O
aim O
of O
helping O
to O
secure O
a O
broader O
user O
base O
, O
3Com O
provides O
this O
vulnerability O
information O
confidentially O
to O
security O
vendors O
( O
including O
competitors O
) O
who O
have O
a O
vulnerability O
protection O
or O
mitigation O
product O
. O

About O
the O
Zero O
Day O
Initiative O
( O
ZDI O
) O
: O
Established O
by O
TippingPoint O
, O
a O
division O
of O
3Com O
, O
The O
Zero O
Day O
Initiative O
( O
ZDI O
) O
represents O
a O
best-of-breed O
model O
for O
rewarding O
security O
researchers O
for O
responsibly O
disclosing O
discovered O
vulnerabilities O
. O

Vendor O
: O
3Com O
TippingPoint O

Vendor O
Response O
: O
This O
issue O
has O
been O
addressed O
in O
TippingPoint O
SMS O
Server O
release O
version O
2.2.1.4478 O
. O

3Com O
does O
not O
re-sell O
the O
vulnerability O
details O
or O
any O
exploit O
code O
. O

Due O
to O
insufficient O
protections O
on O
specific O
directories O
, O
an O
attacker O
with O
access O
to O
the O
web O
interface O
may O
be O
able O
to O
view O
benign O
data O
such O
as O
the O
user O
manual O
. O

Customers O
can O
obtain O
the O
update O
through O
the O
SMS O
device O
or O
by O
visiting O
: O
The O
3Com O
vendor O
advisory O
is O
available O
from O
: O
Disclosure O
Timeline O
: O
2006.01.19 O
- O
Vulnerability O
reported O
to O
vendor O
2006.05.09 O
- O
Coordinated O
public O
release O
of O
advisory O
Credit O
: O
This O
vulnerability O
was O
discovered O
by O
Micheal O

. O

: O

. O

function O
in O

. O

smcFanControl O
2.1.3 O
About O
smcFanControl O
First O
of O

, O
this O
is O
a O

and O

Fix O
Hendrik O

smcFanControl O
2.1.3 O
. O

In O

that O

are O
still O
in O

mode O
, O
so O

speed O

your O

if O

. O

Nov O

: O
Hendrik O

. O

Code O
from O

snip O
snip O

, O

{ O

; O

Overflow O

Reason O
: O
KERN_INVALID_ADDRESS O
at O
address O
: O
0x43434343 O
0x43434343 O
in O

Quote O
from O
the O
Official O
WebSite O
: O
smcFanControl O
lets O
the O
user O
set O
the O
minimum O
speed O
of O
the O
build O
in O

. O

: O
Initial O

contact O
: O
Nov O
10th O
, O
2008 O
: O

contact O
sent O
to O
holtmann O

, O
while O

are O
having O

. O

It O
has O
not O
been O
verified O
if O
other O
version O
( O
version O
1.x O
maybe O
) O
are O

. O

Description O
First O
of O
all O
, O
let O
us O
look O
at O
/Applications/smcFanControl.app/Contents/Resources/smc O
Input O
option O
of O
smc O
-k O
was O
not O

to O
handle O
large O
buffer O
. O

: O
Vendor O
response O
: O
Nov O
10th O
, O
2008 O
: O
Hendrik O
Holtmann O
response O
as O
soon O
as O
we O
finish O
our O
coffee O
. O

Your O
use O
of O
the O
information O
on O
the O
advisory O
or O
materials O
linked O
from O
the O
advisory O
is O
at O
your O
own O
risk O
. O

However O
in O
order O
not O
to O
damage O
your O
machine O
scFanControl O
let O
you O
not O
set O
minimum O
speed O
to O
a O
rate O
under O
Apple O
defaults O
. O

So O
you O
can O
increase O
your O
minimum O
fan O
speed O
to O
make O
your O
intel O
mac O
run O
cooler O
. O

) O
( O

) O

r O
eax O

PGP SN

The O

The O

of O

) O

in O

Desktop O

The O

( O

Description O
: O
Used O
by O
HP O
Printer/Scanner/Copier O
printers O
to O
prevent O

from O

most O

other O
products O
are O
affected O
Overview O
: O
There O
is O
a O

exists O

which O

to O
gain O

. O

There O
are O

are O

than O
we O
expected O
. O

: O

Local O

: O

to O

for O

Driver O

. O

Sowhat O
Life O
is O
like O
a O

, O
Do O
you O
know O
how O
to O
exploit O
it O

Vendor O
responded O
2006.07.20 O
HP O
- O
This O
is O
a O
high O
priority O
issue O
, O
and O
is O
still O
being O
worked O
. O

File O
Location O
: O
% O
System O
% O
Service O
Name O
: O
PML O
Driver O
HPZ12 O
Service O
Display O
Name O
: O
PML O
Driver O
HPZ12 O
Because O
of O
the O
Insecure O
DACL O
, O
a O
local O

user O
can O
obtain O
SYSTEM O

: O

driver O

D O
: O
attack O
attack.exe O

: O
sc O
start O
pml O
driver O
hpz12 O
OK O
, O
your O
attack.exe O
will O
be O
lunached O
under O
SYSTEM O
privileges O

, O

restart O
is O
not O
required O
. O

We O
have O
not O
yet O
issue O
a O
security O
bulletin O
on O
this O
problem O
2007.01.08 O
They O
did O
not O
response O
to O
my O

query O
emails O
after O
20th O
, O
Dec O
Is O
this O
HP O
Responsible O
Vulnerability O
Disclosure O
Policy O

though O

PML O
Driver O
serivce O
is O
not O

, O

can O

Scope O
The O
aim O
of O
this O
document O
is O
to O
clearly O
define O
an O
issue O
that O
exists O
with O
the O
VMware O
ESX O
Server O
product O
that O
will O
allow O
a O
local O
attacker O
to O
gain O
access O
to O
users O
( O
including O
root O
) O
passwords O
under O
certain O
conditions O
. O

VMware O
ESX O
Server O
includes O
a O
number O
of O
network O
services O
and O
a O
web O
application O
, O
called O
the O
VMware O
Management O
Interface O
that O
can O
be O
used O
to O
perform O
remote O
administration O
of O
the O
system O
. O

References O
Revision O
a O
. O

About O
Corsaire O
Corsaire O
are O
a O
leading O
information O
security O
consultancy O
, O
founded O
in O
1997 O
in O
Guildford O
, O
Surrey O
, O
UK O
. O

Instead O
, O
it O
uses O
a O
custom O
x86 O
kernel O
as O
the O
host O
, O
along O
with O
a O
customised O
Linux O
operating O
system O
as O
a O
console O
O/S O
. O

The O
software O
provides O
a O
virtualization O
layer O
that O
allows O
multiple O
x86 O
based O
operating O
systems O
to O
run O
on O
the O
same O
hardware O
concurrently O
. O

The O
ESX O
Server O
product O
differs O
from O
other O
VMware O
products O
in O
that O
it O
does O
not O
require O
a O
host O

system O
to O

provided O
by O
the O
user O
. O

WebKit O
, O
as O
used O
in O
Apple SN

before SV
5.1 SV
and O

before SV
10.6 SV
, O
allows O

to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
or O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
memory O
corruption O
and O
application O
crash O
) O
via O
a O
crafted O
web O
site O
, O
a O
different O
vulnerability O
than O
other O
WebKit O
CVEs O
listed O
in O

and O
APPLE-SA-2012-03-07-2 O
. O

NOTE O
: O
it O
was O
originally O
reported O
that O
the O
affected O
product O
is O
HP O
Diagnostics O
Server O
, O
but O
HP O
states O
that O
the O
vulnerable O
product O
is O
actually O
HP O
LoadRunner O
. O

Stack-based O
buffer O
overflow O
in O
magentservice.exe O
in O
the O
server O
in O
HP SN
LoadRunner SN
11.00 SV
before SV
patch SV
4 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
via O
a O
crafted O
size O
value O
in O
a O
packet O
. O

overflow O
in O
an O

control O
in O

before SV
7.0 SV
might O
allow O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
via O
a O
long O
string O
value O
in O
unspecified O
parameters O
. O

overflow O
in O
ChaSen SN
2.4.x SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
via O
a O
crafted O
string O
. O

buffer O

in O

CSoundFile O
: O
:ReadS3M O
function O
in O
src/load_s3m.cpp O
in O

Vincent O
Danen O
2011-08-04 O
16:42:51 O
EDT O
A O
number O
of O
vulnerabilities O
were O
reported O
in O
libmodplug O
, O
which O
can O
be O
exploited O
to O
cause O
a O
DoS O
or O
possibly O
compromise O
an O
application O
using O
the O
library O
: O
1 O
) O
An O
integer O
overflow O
error O
exists O
within O
the O
CSoundFile O
: O
:ReadWav O
( O
) O
function O
( O
src/load_wav.cpp O
) O
when O
processing O
certain O
WAV O
files O
. O

Upstream O
patches O
are O
available O
to O
correct O
the O
flaws O
While O
older O
gstreamer-plugins O
contains O
an O
embedded O
copy O
of O
libmodplug O
, O
it O
is O
not O
yet O
known O
to O
what O
extent O
it O
is O
affected O
by O
these O
flaws O
. O

2 O
) O
Boundary O
errors O
within O
the O
CSoundFile O
: O
:ReadS3M O
( O
) O
function O
( O
src/load_s3m.cpp O
) O
when O
processing O
S3M O
files O
can O
be O
exploited O
to O
cause O
stack-based O
buffer O
overflows O
by O
tricking O
a O
user O
into O
opening O
a O
specially O
crafted O
S3M O
file O
. O

This O
can O
be O
exploited O
to O
cause O
a O
heap-based O
buffer O
overflow O
by O
tricking O
a O
user O
into O
opening O
a O
specially O
crafted O
WAV O
file O
. O

seems O
to O

Another O
swedish O
company O
this O
time O
, O
Intellicom O
develops O
a O
serie O
of O
SCADA O
products/devices O
named O
NetBiter O
WebSCADA O
which O
are O
based O
on O
HMS O
AnyBus O
RemoteCOM O
device O
. O

Any O
value O
after O
the O
= O
can O
be O
modified O
. O

The O
device O
checks O
the O
MAC O
against O
it O
own O
and O
if O
matches O
then O
proceeds O
to O
update O
its O
internal O
registers.The O
first O
three O
bytes O
of O
the O
MAC O
are O
always O
00-30-11 O
which O
correspond O
to O
the O
HMS O
oui O
as O
expected O
. O

old O
password O
( O
if O
any O
, O
admin O
by O
default O
) O
+ O
new O
password O
= O
fatbird O
; O

We O
can O
download O
the O
firmware O
, O
as O
well O
as O
two O
tools O
to O
configure O
and O
update O
these O
devices O
respectively.Free O
goods O
are O
always O
nice O
. O

If O
we O
fill O
hn O
parameter O
( O
HostName O
) O
with O
more O
than O
0x20 O
bytes O
, O
we O
can O
start O
to O
overwrite O
data O
in O
the O
stack O
. O

So O
let O
take O
a O
look O
at O
the O
exports O
: O
Code O
( O
asm O
) O
.text:100027AF O
; O
int O
cdecl O

( O
) O
.text:100027AF O
public O
HICP_SendModuleScan O
@ O
@ O
YAHXZ O
.text:100027AF O

@ O
@ O
YAHXZ O

near O
.text:100027AF O
push O
ebp O
.text:100027B0 O
mov O
ebp O
, O
esp O
.text:100027B2 O
call O
sub_10002175 O
.text:100027B7 O
pop O
ebp O
.text:100027B8 O
retn O
.text:100027B8 O
HICP_SendModuleScan O
@ O
@ O
YAHXZ O
endp O
In O
C O
Code O
( O
c O
) O
sprintf O
( O
& O
Dest O
, O
Module O
Scan O
) O
; O
to.sa_family O
= O
AF_INET O
; O
( O
_WORD O
) O
& O
to.sa_data O
= O
htons O
( O

) O
; O
3250 O
UDP O
( O
_DWORD O
) O
& O
to.sa_data O
= O
htonl O
( O

) O
; O
v1 O
= O
strlen O
( O
& O
Dest O
) O
; O
if O
( O
sendto O
( O
s O
, O
& O
Dest O
, O
v1 O
+ O
1 O
, O
0 O
, O
& O

, O
16 O
) O
! O
= O
-1 O
) O
So O
we O
can O
see O
that O
in O
order O
to O
scan O
the O
network O
, O
this O
tool O
sends O
a O
broadcast O
UDP O
packet O
containing O
the O
string O
Module O
Scan O
to O
the O
HICP O
port O
( O
3250 O
) O
. O

Network O
Mask O
+ O
gw O
= O
192.168.1.1 O
; O

However O
, O
this O
one O
contains O
a O
surprise O
. O

HICP O
, O
is O
intented O
to O
configure O
HMS O
products O
that O
include O
ethernet O
capabilities O
, O
since O
they O
need O
a O
method O
for O
configuring O
Internal O
IP O
, O
DCHP O
, O
NetworkMask O
, O
DNS O
, O
gateway O
... O
. O

Device O
Type O
+ O
module O
version O
= O
0.66.6 O
; O

That O
all O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
this O
request O
, O
there O
are O
a O
couple O
of O
additional O
replyes O
implemented O
: O
+ O
Invalid O
Password O
: O
to O
indicate O
a O
failed O
configuration O
attempt O
+ O
Reconfigured O
: O
to O
indicate O
success O
. O

Despite O
of O
the O
fact O
that O
this O
protocol O
is O
not O
complex O
, O
I O
think O
it O
has O
a O
potential O
interest O
regarding O
SCADA O
security.You O
ll O
see O
why O
. O

The O
firmware O
is O
a O
custom O
linux O
for O
MotorolaColdFire O
processor O
. O

Make O
your O
own O
conclusions O
about O
the O
security O
level O
of O
this O
protocol.I O
m O
just O
presenting O
facts O
. O

In O
2004 O
HMS O
released O
a O
free O
tool O
named O
Anybus O
IPconfig O
which O
can O
be O
used O
to O
scan O
a O
network O
where O
the O
devices O
are O
connected O
, O
then O
proceeding O
to O
configure O
them O
. O

Ok O
, O
NetBiterConfig.exe O
is O
listening O
on O
3250/UDP O
receiving O
packets O
for O
any O
interface O
, O
so O
we O
can O
send O
a O

from O
outside O

to O

are O

device O
. O

Let O

what O

. O

Once O

, O
which O
contains O
its O
current O

to O

network O
on O

. O

simple O

( O

) O
. O

tools O

. O

bytes O

control O
panel O

Resolution O
| O
Two O
fixes O
have O
been O
added O
to O
check O
the O
provided O
data O
to O
ensure O
it O
does O
not O
exceed O
static O
buffer O
sizes O
. O

Both O
overflows O
can O
be O
caused O
by O
an O
INVITE O
or O
any O
other O
SIP O
packet O
with O
SDP O
. O

When O
reading O
RTP O
payloads O
from O
SDP O
a O
maximum O
limit O
of O
32 O
in O
total O
will O
be O
enforced O
. O

This O
causes O
an O
invalid O
memory O
write O
outside O
of O
the O
buffer O
. O

This O
causes O
a O
buffer O
on O
the O
stack O
to O
overflow O
allowing O
the O
attacker O
to O
write O
values O
between O
0 O
and O
256 O
( O
the O
maximum O
payload O
number O
) O
to O
memory O
locations O
after O
the O
buffer O
. O

When O
removing O
internal O
information O
regarding O
an O
RTP O
payload O
the O
given O
payload O
number O
will O
now O
be O
checked O
to O
make O
sure O
it O
does O
not O
exceed O
the O
maximum O
acceptable O
payload O
number O
. O

The O
second O
overflow O
is O
caused O
by O
sending O
more O
than O
32 O
RTP O
payloads O
. O

Asterisk O
| O
Asterisk O
1.4 O
revision O
109386 O
. O

The O
request O
may O
need O
to O
be O
authenticated O
depending O
on O
configuration O
of O
the O
Asterisk O
installation O
. O

Any O
further O
RTP O
payloads O
will O
be O
discarded O
. O

Available O
by O
performing O
| O
| O
Appliance O
| O
an O
svn O
update O
of O
the O
AADK O
tree O
. O

While O
this O
does O
not O
allow O
the O
attacker O
to O
write O
arbitrary O
data O
it O
does O
allow O
the O
attacker O
to O
write O
a O
0 O
to O
other O
memory O
locations O
. O

The O
first O
overflow O
is O
caused O
by O
sending O
a O
payload O
number O
that O
surpasses O
the O
programmed O
maximum O
payload O
number O
of O
256 O
. O

Permission O
is O
hereby O
granted O
to O
distribute O
and O
publish O
this O
advisory O
in O
its O
original O
, O
unaltered O
form O
. O

AST-2008-002 O
: O
Two O
buffer O
overflows O
in O
RTP O
Codec O
Payload O
Handling O

Net/DNS/RR/A.pm O
in O
Net SN
: O
:DNS SN
0.60 SV
build SV
654 SV
, O
as O
used O
in O
packages O
such O
as O

allows O

( O

. O

The O

: O

) O

ZDI-07-057 O
: O
Firebird O
process_packet O
( O
) O
Remote O
Stack O
Overflow O
Vulnerability O

Buffer O
overflow O
in O
the O
logging O
capability O
for O
the O
DHCP O
daemon O
( O
DHCPD O
) O
for O
ISC SN

3.0.1rc12 SV
and SV
3.0.1rc13 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O

of O
service O
( O

) O
and O
possibly O
execute O

code O
via O

options O
in O
( O

) O

, O
( O

, O

( O

, O

( O

, O

can O

string O

to O

file O
. O

Buffer O
overflow O
in O

package O
, O
as O
used O
in O
WinZip SN
6.2 SV
through SV
WinZip O
8.1 SV

to O

code O
via O
a O

archive O
with O
certain O
long O

parameters O
. O

stack-based O
buffer O
overflows O
in O
( O

) O

and O
( O
2 O
) O

for O

before SV

allow O

( O

) O
or O

9 O
captures O
. O

Solution O
: O
Select O
the O
updated O
source O
RPM O
appropriate O
for O
your O
OpenPKG O
release O
, O
fetch O
it O
from O
the O
OpenPKG O
FTP O
service O
or O
a O
mirror O
location O
, O
verify O
its O
integrity O
, O
build O
a O
corresponding O
binary O
RPM O
from O
it O
and O
update O
your O
OpenPKG O
installation O
by O
applying O
the O
binary O
RPM O
. O

.rpm O
References O

: O

: O

: O
ftp.openpkg.org/release/1.2/UPD O
ftp O
: O
ftp.openpkg.org/release/1.3/UPD O

security O
reasons O
, O
this O

was O

signed O
with O
the O
OpenPGP O

key O

( O

from O

hkp O
: O

Description O
: O
Andr O
xc3 O
xa9 O
Malo O
discovered O
buffer O
overflows O
in O
the O
mod_alias O
and O

of O

webserver O
. O

Affected O

: O

the O
instructions O
on O
for O
details O
on O
how O
to O
verify O
the O

of O
this O
advisory O
. O

These O
occurred O
if O
a O
regular O
expression O
with O
more O
than O
9 O
capturing O
parenthesis O
was O

. O

OpenPKG-SA-2003.046 O
28-Oct-2003 O
Package O
: O
apache O
Vulnerability O
: O
local O
buffer O
overflow O
OpenPKG O
Specific O
: O
no O

For O
the O
current O
release O
OpenPKG O
1.3 O
, O
perform O
the O
following O
operations O
to O
permanently O
fix O
the O
security O
problem O
( O
for O
other O
releases O
adjust O
accordingly O
) O
. O

Affected O
Packages O
: O
Corrected O
Packages O
: O
OpenPKG O
CURRENT O
< O
= O
apache-1.3.28-20031009 O
> O
= O
apache-1.3.29-20031028 O
OpenPKG O
1.3 O
< O
= O
apache-1.3.28-1.3.0 O
> O
= O

OpenPKG O
1.2 O
< O
= O
apache-1.3.27-1.2.2 O
> O
= O
apache-1.3.27-1.2.3 O
Dependent O
Packages O
: O
none O

To O
exploit O
this O
, O
an O
attacker O
would O
need O
to O
be O
able O
to O
locally O
create O
a O
carefully O
crafted O
configuration O
file O
( O
.htaccess O
or O
httpd.conf O
) O
. O

If O
you O
have O
the O
apache O
package O
installed O
and O
its O
version O
is O
affected O
( O
see O
above O
) O
, O

recommend O
that O
you O
immediately O
upgrade O
it O
( O
see O

) O
. O

[ O
OpenPKG-SA-2003.046 O
] O
OpenPKG O
Security O
Advisory O
( O
apache O
) O

Multiple O
buffer O
overflows O
in O

in O
HP-UX SN
10.20 SV
and SV
11.00 SV
( O

6.0.192 SV
and O
possibly O
other O
versions O
before SV
8.0 SV
) O
allow O
local O
users O
to O
gain O
privileges O
via O
long O
arguments O
to O
( O
1 O
) O

, O
( O
2 O

, O
( O

) O

, O
and O
( O

, O
some O
of O
which O
may O
share O
the O
same O
underlying O
function O

, O
a O
different O
vulnerability O
than O
CVE-2001-0085 O
. O

overflow O
in O
administrative O
web O

for O

printer O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O

of O

long O

. O

overflow O
in O

in O

4.3.3 SV
. O

overflows O

CVE-2011-3190 O
Apache O
Tomcat O
Authentication O
bypass O
and O
information O
disclosure O
Severity O
: O
Important O

Description O
: O
Apache O
Tomcat O
supports O
the O
AJP O
protocol O
which O
is O
used O
with O
reverse O
proxies O
to O
pass O
requests O
and O
associated O
data O
about O
the O
request O
from O
the O
reverse O
proxy O
to O
Tomcat O
. O

This O
permitted O
an O
attacker O
to O
have O
full O
control O
over O
the O
AJP O
message O
which O
allowed O
an O
attacker O
to O
( O
amongst O
other O
things O
) O
: O
- O
insert O
the O
name O
of O
an O
authenticated O
user O
- O
insert O
any O
client O
IP O
address O
( O
potentially O
bypassing O
any O
client O
IP O
address O
filtering O
) O
- O
trigger O
the O
mixing O
of O
responses O
between O
users O
The O
following O
AJP O
connector O
implementations O
are O
not O
affected O
: O
org.apache.jk.server.JkCoyoteHandler O
( O
5.5.x O
- O
default O
, O
6.0.x O
- O
default O
) O
The O
following O
AJP O
connector O
implementations O
are O
affected O
: O
org.apache.coyote.ajp.AjpProtocol O
( O
6.0.x O
, O
7.0.x O
- O
default O
) O
org.apache.coyote.ajp.AjpNioProtocol O
( O
7.0.x O
) O
org.apache.coyote.ajp.AjpAprProtocol O
( O
5.5.x O
, O
6.0.x O
, O
7.0.x O
) O
Further O
, O
this O
issue O
only O
applies O
if O
all O
of O
the O
following O
are O
are O
true O
for O
at O
least O
one O
resource O
: O
- O
POST O
requests O
are O
accepted O
- O
The O
request O
body O
is O
not O
processed O
Example O
: O
See O
Mitigation O
: O
Users O
of O
affected O
versions O
should O
apply O
one O
of O
the O
following O
mitigations O
: O
- O
Upgrade O
to O
a O
version O
of O
Apache O
Tomcat O
that O
includes O
a O
fix O
for O
this O
issue O
when O
available O
- O
Apply O
the O
appropriate O
patch O
- O
7.0.x O
- O
6.0.x O
- O
5.5.x O
- O
Configure O
the O
reverse O
proxy O
and O
Tomcat O
AJP O
connector O
( O
s O
) O
to O
use O
the O
requiredSecret O
attribute O
- O
Use O
the O

Vendor O
: O
The O
Apache O
Software O
Foundation O
Versions O

The O
Apache O
Tomcat O
security O
team O
strongly O
discourages O
reporting O
of O
undisclosed O
vulnerabilities O
via O
public O
channels O
. O

All O
Apache O
Tomcat O
security O
vulnerabilities O
should O
be O
reported O
to O
the O
private O
security O
team O
mailing O
list O
: O
security O
( O
at O
) O
tomcat.apache O
( O
dot O
) O
org O
[ O
email O
concealed O
] O
References O
: O

The O
AJP O
protocol O
is O
designed O
so O
that O
when O
a O
request O
includes O
a O
request O
body O
, O
an O
unsolicited O
AJP O
message O
is O
sent O
to O
Tomcat O
that O
includes O
the O
first O

( O
or O
possibly O
all O
) O
of O
the O
request O
body O
. O

466 O

:Pickle O

classes/session/cc_admin_session.php O
in O
CubeCart SN
4.3.4 SV
does O
not O
properly O
restrict O
administrative O
access O
permissions O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
restrictions O
and O
gain O
administrative O
access O
via O
a O

request O
that O
contains O
an O
empty O
( O
1 O
) O
sessID O
( O
ccAdmin O
cookie O
) O
, O
( O
2 O
) O
X_CLUSTER_CLIENT_IP O
header O
, O
or O
( O
3 O
) O
User-Agent O
header O
. O

Especially O
when O
the O
product O
is O
processing O
credit O
card O
data O
, O
like O
CubeCart O
does O
. O

Vendor O
Status O
: O

It O
easy O
to O
bypass O
it O
without O
providing O
any O
credentials O
. O

When O
an O
administrator O
logs O
in O
, O
the O
applications O
stores O
his O
session O
ID O
, O
browser O
( O
user O
agent O
) O
and O
IP O
address O
in O
the O
sessId O
, O
browser O
and O
sessIP O
fields O
. O

... O
CubeCart O
has O
developed O
a O
large O
fanbase O
, O
due O
in O
part O
, O
to O
the O
relative O
ease O
of O
creating O
modifications O
and O
enhancements O
. O

And O
then O
, O
on O
the O
first O
line O
there O
is O
: O
if O
( O
isset O
( O
$ O
_SERVER O
[ O
HTTP_X_CLUSTER_CLIENT_IP O
detectSSL O
( O
) O
) O
return O
$ O
_SERVER O
[ O
HTTP_X_CLUSTER_CLIENT_IP O
] O
; O
This O
line O
will O
bypass O
all O
those O
complex O
checks O
. O

TABLE O
`CubeCart_transactions` O
( O

int O
( O
11 O
) O

NULL O

, O

( O

) O
, O

( O

) O
, O

int O
( O

) O
, O

( O

) O
, O

( O

) O
, O

( O

) O
, O

( O

) O
, O

decimal O
( O

) O
DEFAULT O
0.00 O
NOT O
NULL O
, O
`notes` O
text O
, O
PRIMARY O
KEY O
( O
`id` O
) O
, O
KEY O
`customer_id` O
( O
`customer_id` O
) O
) O
ENGINE O
MyISAM O
DEFAULT O
CHARSET=utf8 O
AUTO_INCREMENT=1 O
COLLATE=utf8_unicode_ci O
; O
Dumping O
data O
for O
table O
`CubeCart_transactions` O
An O
administrator O
can O
install O
CubeCart O
packages O
, O
and O
it O
trivial O
to O
create O

How O

The O
HTTP_USER_AGENT O
check O
can O
be O
easily O
bypassed O
using O
an O
empty O
user O
agent O
. O

CubeCart O
is O
using O
a O
MySQL O
table O
named O
CubeCart_admin_users O
for O
storing O
information O
about O
administrative O
users O
. O

Here O
is O
a O
sample O
HTTP O
request O
that O
will O
dump O
the O
whole O
database O
in O
one O
request O
: O
POST O
/CubeCart-latest/admin.php O
_g=maintenance/backup O

: O

`cubecartlatest` O

So O
, O
you O
just O
need O
to O
send O
an O
X_CLUSTER_CLIENT_IP O
header O
with O
an O
empty O
value O
. O

But O
when O
the O
administrative O
user O
is O
logged O
out O
, O
sessID O
is O
empty O
. O

CubeCart O
is O
not O
Open O
Source O
software O
, O
although O
full O
source O
code O
is O
available O
at O
no O
cost O
, O
and O
the O
custom O
licensing O
model O
allows O
for O
customisation O
of O
the O
code O
. O

An O
attacker O
can O
later O
perform O
any O
actions O
the O
administrator O
can O
, O
such O
as O
dumping O
the O
database O
, O
install O
modules O
( O
PHP O
code O
execution O
) O
and O
so O
on O
. O

Therefore O
, O
PHP O
code O
execution O
is O
possible O
and O
quite O
trivial O
to O
achieve O
. O

( O
1 O
[ O
6-9 O
] O
|2 O
[ O
0-9 O
] O
|3 O
[ O
12 O
] O
) O
|192 O

address O
) O
) O
{ O

( O

( O

, O

) O
{ O

= O

; O

There O
are O
all O
these O
complex O
checks O
for O
validating O
$ O
_SERVER O
[ O
REMOTE_ADDR O
] O
. O

So O
, O
we O
can O
bypass O
this O
check O
by O
using O
an O
empty O
sessID O
. O

In O
the O
September/October O
2007 O
issue O
of O
Practical O
eCommerce O
magazine O
, O
CubeCart O
was O
placed O
at O
1 O
in O
their O
list O
of O
100 O
Most O
Notable O
Shopping O
Carts O
. O

Vendor O
has O
released O
an O
updated O
version O
I O
. O

Basically O
, O
session O
managament O
for O
administrative O
users O
is O
flawed O
. O

Description O
While O
auditing O
the O
source O
code O
of O
CubeCart SN
version O
v4.3.4 SV
, O
I O
ve O
found O
a O
critical O
vulnerability O
in O
this O
application O
. O

However O
, O
$ O
_SERVER O
[ O
REMOTE_ADDR O
] O
can O
not O
be O
faked O
. O

Background O
From O
Wikipedia O
: O
CubeCart O
is O
a O
free-to-use O
eCommerce O
software O
solution O
, O
designed O
to O
allow O
individuals O
and O
businesses O
sell O
tangible O
and O
digital O
goods O
on O
line O
. O

. O

, O

) O

and O

any O

. O

WHERE O

= O
% O

$ O

> O

This O
will O
select O

for O

to O

. O

$ O
client_ip O
|| O
$ O

[ O
browser O
] O
! O

are O
2 O
more O
checks O
that O
need O
to O

: O

is O

if O
( O

Mosso O
if O
( O

( O

( O

$ O

[ O

Otherwise O
use O
standard O
IP O
checks O
$ O
address O
= O
false O
; O
if O
( O
isset O
( O

REMOTE_ADDR O

( O

) O
{ O

( O

. O

This O
line O
of O
code O
( O
the O
one O
with O
X_CLUSTER_CLIENT_IP O
) O
looks O
like O
a O
hack O
to O
me O
. O

Let O
look O
at O
the O
code O
: O
Filename O
includes O
functions.inc.php O
, O
line O
36 O
: O
Get O
Client O
IP O
Address O
function O
get_ip_address O
( O
) O
{ O
New O
line O
added O
for O
cluser/cloud O
type O
hosting O
e.g O
. O

At O
first O
I O
was O
thinking O
that O
it O
not O
possible O
to O
bypass O
that O
. O

It O
was O
probably O
added O
later O
to O
fix O
some O
bug O
or O
add O
a O
new O
feature O
. O

CubeCart O
4 O
Session O
Management O
Bypass O

The O
Firewall O
in O
Apple SN
Mac SN
OS SN
X SN
10.5.8 SV
drops O
unspecified O
firewall O
rules O
after O
a O
reboot O
, O
which O
might O
allow O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
intended O
access O
restrictions O
via O
packet O
data O
, O
related O
to O
a O
timing O
issue O
. O

Multiple O
F-Secure O
anti-virus O
products O
, O
including O
Anti-Virus SN
for O
Microsoft O
Exchange O
7.10 SV
and SV
earlier SV
; O
Internet SN
Gatekeeper SN
for O
Windows O
6.61 SV
and SV
earlier SV
, O
Windows O
6.61 SV
and SV
earlier SV
, O
and O
Linux SN
2.16 SV
and SV
earlier SV
; O
Internet SN
Security SN
2009 SV
and SV
earlier SV
, O
Anti-Virus SN
2009 SV
and SV
earlier SV
, O
Client SN
Security SN
8.0 SV
and SV
earlier SV
, O
and O
others O
; O
allow O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
malware O
detection O
via O
a O
crafted O
( O
1 O
) O
ZIP O
and O
( O
2 O
) O
RAR O
archive O
. O

Blue O
Coat O
ProxySG O
, O
when O
transparent O
interception O
mode O
is O
enabled O
, O
uses O
the O
HTTP O
Host O
header O
to O
determine O
the O
remote O
endpoint O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
access O
controls O
for O
Flash O
, O
Java O
, O
Silverlight O
, O
and O
probably O
other O
technologies O
, O
and O
possibly O
communicate O
with O
restricted O
intranet O
sites O
, O
via O
a O
crafted O
web O
page O
that O
causes O
a O
client O
to O
send O
HTTP O
requests O
with O
a O
modified O
Host O
header O
. O

OpenSC SN
before SV
0.11.7 SV
allows O
physically O
proximate O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
intended O
PIN O
requirements O
and O
read O
private O
data O
objects O
via O
a O
( O
1 O
) O
low O
level O
APDU O
command O
or O
( O
2 O
) O
debugging O
tool O
, O
as O
demonstrated O
by O
reading O
the O
4601 O
or O
4701 O
file O
with O
the O
opensc-explorer O
or O
opensc-tool O
program O
. O

If O
you O
have O
a O
problem O
with O
an O
older O
version O
or O
patched O
version O
, O
you O
need O
to O
try O
the O
latest O
release O
. O

This O
will O
harm O
all O
users O
of O
several O
concurrent O
applications O
trying O
to O
use O
smart O
cards O
. O

After O
testing O
you O
can O
erase O
a O
card O
with O
this O
command O
: O
pkcs15-init O
erase-card O
use-default-transport-keys O
WARNING O
! O

User O
b.badrignans O
reported O
this O
security O
problem O
on O
December O
4th O
, O
2008 O
. O

If O
you O
are O
interested O
in O
spending O
your O
free O
time O
to O
work O
with O
smart O
cards O
, O
we O
would O
like O
to O
welcome O
you O
to O
the O
project O
, O
and O
will O
try O
to O
help O
you O
and O
support O
your O
work O
. O

Al O
versions O
up SV
to SV
and SV
including SV
0.2.4.1 SV
are O
vulnerable O
, O
but O
the O
new O
experimental O
0.2.5-pre1 O
and O
the O
final O
0.2.5 O
will O
include O
the O
fixed O
OpenSC O
0.11.7 O
. O

But O
without O
locking O
we O
can O
not O
rule O
out O
the O
possibility O
of O
a O
security O
issue O
in O
some O
race O
scenario O
. O

National O
eID O
cards O
and O
other O
cards O
initialised O
by O
other O
software O
are O
not O
affected O
by O
this O
problem O
. O

Thus O
we O
changed O
the O
default O
of O
the O
soft_keygen_allowed O
option O
to O
false O
in O
OpenSC O
0.11.7 O
. O

The O
projects O
needs O
more O
developers O
and O
a O
new O
project O
maintainer O
. O

Regards O
, O
Andreas O
Jellinghaus O
aj O
@ O
... O
nsc-project.org O

This O
fix O
only O
improves O
creating O
new O
private O
data O
objects O
. O

We O
could O
only O
test O
very O
few O
cards O
, O
but O
all O
of O
them O
had O
the O
problem O
, O
and O
the O
fix O
worked O
on O
all O
of O
them O
. O

Only O
later O
a O
severe O
security O
bug O
was O
found O
out O
: O
while O
the O
OpenSC O
PKCS O
11 O
implementation O
requires O
PIN O
verification O
to O
access O
the O
data O
, O
low O
level O
APDU O
commands O
or O
debugging O
tools O
like O
opensc-explorer O
or O
opensc-tool O
can O
access O
the O
private O
data O
without O
any O
authentication O
. O

This O
procedure O
has O
been O
tested O
with O
success O
on O
some O
cards O
, O
but O
no O
guaranty O
of O
any O
kind O
can O
be O
given O
. O

If O
locking O
is O
enabled O
, O
you O
can O
not O
run O
both O
applications O
at O
the O
same O
time O
, O
as O
the O
first O
gets O
the O
lock O
, O
and O
the O
second O
is O
stuck O
till O
the O
first O
application O
is O
quit O
. O

Also O
some O
applications O
seem O
to O
not O
work O
properly O
without O
lock_login O
enabled O
. O

This O
option O
was O
disabled O
by O
default O
a O
while O
ago O
, O
because O
popular O
applications O
like O
Firefox O
and O
Thunderbird O
call O
the O
Login O
function O
when O
they O
are O
started O
( O
and O
OpenSC O
is O
configured O
as O
PKCS O
11 O
module O
) O
. O

State O
of O
OpenSC O
I O
believe O
that O
security O
software O
should O
be O
simple O
, O
well O
designed O
, O
well O
writen O
and O
actively O
maintained O
by O
a O
dedicated O
team O
. O

For O
older O
versions O
the O
file O
name O
is O
usually O
4601 O
for O
the O
first O
data O
object O
( O
private O
or O
not O
) O
, O
and O
it O
is O
never O
protected O
, O
thus O
you O
can O
download O
the O
content O
with O
the O
get O
command O
. O

Version O
001 SV
and SV
002 SV
are O
both O
vulnerable O
, O
a O
new O
version O
003 O
with O
OpenSC O
0.11.7 O
will O
be O
soon O
available O
. O

link O
with O
iconv O
on O
Mac O
OS O
X O
for O
i18n O
support O
. O

Disable O
allow_soft_keygen O
by O
default O
. O

Cards O
already O
initialised O
with O
such O
private O
data O
objects O
need O
to O
be O
modified O
to O
repair O
the O
access O
control O
conditions O
on O
such O
cards O
. O

OpenSC O
is O
working O
fine O
for O
some O
applications O
, O
like O
using O
it O
with O
openssh O
for O
smart O
card O
authenticated O
ssh O
login O
, O
or O
for O
console O
login O
with O
a O
pam O
module O
, O
or O
testing O
and O
learning O
about O
smart O
cards O
. O

One O
way O
to O
do O
that O
is O
to O
erase O
the O
card O
and O
re-initialise O
it O
, O
but O
doing O
this O
you O
would O
loose O
all O
content O
on O
the O
card O
, O
including O
RSA O
private O
keys O
. O

Security O
fixes O
available O

In O
our O
subversion O
repository O
the O
private O
data O
fix O
is O
available O
as O
revision O
3605 O
, O
the O
new O
default O
settings O
are O
commited O
in O
revision O
3604 O
. O

In O
June O
2007 O
support O
form O
private O
data O
objects O
was O
added O
to O
OpenSC O
. O

RSA O
keys O
are O
not O
affected O
by O
this O
security O
problem O
. O

openct O
virtual O
readers O
reduced O
to O
2 O
by O
default O
. O

Security O
issue O
: O
Fix O
private O
data O
support O
. O

Other O
security O
changes O
When O
OpenSC O
was O
created O
some O
cards O
could O
already O
create O
RSA O
keys O
on O
card O
, O
but O
other O
popular O
cards O
could O
only O
execute O
signing O
and O
decryption O
on O
card O
, O
but O
not O
create O
RSA O
key O
. O

No O
warranty O
of O
any O
kind O
, O
you O
are O
on O
your O
own O
! O

, O
Andreas O
Jellinghaus O

@ O
... O
nsc-project.org O
Security O
update O
for O
OpenSC O
OpenSC O
Security O
Advisory O
[ O
26-Feb-2009 O
] O
CVE-2009-0368 O
OpenSC O
stores O
private O
data O
without O
proper O
access O
restrictions O
. O

This O
could O
always O
be O
turned O
off O
with O
the O
soft_keygen_allowed O
in O
the O
config O
file O
. O

We O
have O
not O
heard O
of O
any O
user O
of O
such O
old O
cards O
without O
the O
capability O
to O
create O
RSA O
keys O
for O
a O
long O
time O
. O

OpenSC O
used O
to O
lock O
access O
to O
a O
smart O
card O
, O
when O
applications O
used O
the O
Login O
function O
with O
OpenSC O
. O

Time O
for O
improving O
OpenSC O
is O
scarce O
if O
it O
exists O
at O
all O
, O
and O
not O
a O
single O
developer O
knows O
the O
OpenSC O
core O
code O
in O
detail O
. O

Our O
old O
Windows O
Installer O
Package O
SCB O
is O
also O
affected O
by O
this O
vulnerability O
: O
All O
versions O
are O
affected O
. O

This O
could O
damage O
your O
card O
or O
erase O
all O
data O
on O
it O
! O

Note O
however O
that O
we O
can O
support O
only O
released O
versions O
of O
OpenSC O
and O
current O
trunk O
. O

We O
don O
t O
have O
any O
windows O
developer O
left O
, O
so O
no O
one O
can O
update O
this O
package O
. O

pinpad O
supported O
fixed O
for O
Mac O
OS O
X O
. O

Testing O
your O
card O
: O
To O
create O
a O
file O
with O
a O
secret O
: O
echo O
This O
is O
my O
secret O
data O
secret-file O
To O
initialise O
a O
blank O
card O
: O
pkcs15-init O
create-pkcs15 O
use-default-transport-keys O
profile O
pkcs15+onepin O
pin O
123456 O
puk O
78907890 O
To O
write O
a O
private O
data O
object O
to O
the O
card O
: O
pkcs11-tool O
label O
my O
secret O
type O
data O
write-object O
secret-file O
private O
login O
pin O
123456 O
To O
see O
all O
objects O
on O
the O
card O
: O
pkcs15-tool O
dump O
This O
will O
list O
the O
data O
object O
, O
including O
the O
path O
it O
is O
stored O
, O
e.g O
. O

An O
alternative O
is O
to O
download O
the O
private O
data O
object O
( O
s O
) O
to O
your O
PC O
, O
delete O
them O
on O
the O
card O
, O
and O
store O
them O
once O
more O
on O
the O
card O
with O
the O
new O
, O
fixed O
version O
of O
OpenSC O
. O

I O
m O
sad O
to O
inform O
you O
that O
OpenSC O
is O
a O
rather O
large O
and O
complex O
software O
, O
the O
design O
shows O
that O
is O
clearly O
grown O
over O
the O
years O
. O

But O
in O
general O
you O
need O
to O
judge O
yourself O
if O
the O
state O
of O
OpenSC O
is O
compatible O
with O
your O
requirements O
. O

This O
was O
fixed O
in O
OpenSC O
0.11.7 O
. O

Also O
you O
can O
t O
use O
any O
other O
application O
at O
the O
same O
time O
, O
for O
example O
you O
can O
t O
use O
a O
screensaver O
with O
smart O
card O
authentication O
. O

All O
other O
cards O
are O
completely O
untested O
for O
either O
. O

ruToken O
driver O
was O
updated O
. O

Only O
blank O
cards O
initialised O
with O
OpenSC O
are O
affected O
by O
this O
problem O
. O

: O
Path O
: O
3f0050154701 O
To O
access O
such O
an O
object O
with O
low O
level O
tools O
: O
opensc-explorer O
cd O
5015 O
get O
4701 O
New O
versions O
of O
OpenSC O
will O
not O
allow O
this O
to O
succeed O
. O

Most O
developers O
stopped O
being O
interested O
in O
smart O
cards O
many O
years O
ago O
, O
only O
few O
are O
left O
, O
of O
those O
nearly O
noone O
actually O
uses O
smart O
cards O
day O
to O
day O
. O

Binary O
distributions O
Our O
Mac O
OS O
X O
Installer O
Package O
SCA O
is O
well O
maintained O
and O
a O
new O
version O
including O
this O
new O
version O
will O
be O
available O
soon O
. O

Still O
we O
revised O
this O
default O
setting O
in O
OpenSC O
0.11.7 O
and O
enabled O
lock_login O
by O
default O
. O

Only O
follow O
this O
procedure O
if O
you O
know O
what O
you O
are O
doing O
. O

Users O
of O
Siemens O
CardOS O
based O
smart O
cards O
will O
still O
need O
to O
turn O
this O
option O
on O
, O
if O
they O
want O
to O
use O
the O
split-key O
option O
to O
work O
around O
limitations O
in O
the O
CardOS O
card O
operating O
system O
( O
not O
being O
able O
to O
have O
RSA O
keys O
valid O
for O
both O
signing O
and O
decryption O
) O
. O

You O
need O
to O
subscribe O
to O
these O
lists O
before O
posting O
, O
as O
we O
are O
getting O
a O
lot O
of O
spam O
each O
day O
and O
do O
not O
have O
the O
resource O
to O
sort O
out O
valid O
email O
. O

It O
is O
not O
known O
if O
the O
problem O
is O
limited O
to O
some O
drivers O
, O
but O
we O
believe O
all O
drivers O
are O
affected O
. O

New O
windows O
binaries O
build O
using O
mingw O
are O
available O
in O
the O
Build O
project O
. O

Subject O
: O
OpenSC O
Security O
Advisory O
OpenSC O
today O
released O
a O
new O
version O
OpenSC O
0.11.7 O
with O
these O
changes O
: O
hide_empty_slots O
now O
on O
by O
default O
. O

Contact O
and O
Feedback O
If O
you O
have O
questions O
or O
feedback O
, O
please O
do O
not O
hesitate O
to O
contact O
us O
on O
our O
mailing O
lists O
opensc-devel O
or O
opensc-user O
. O

Enable O
lock_login O
by O
default O
. O

The O
OpenSC O
code O
was O
written O
to O
use O
the O
hardware O
RSA O
key O
creation O
, O
if O
the O
card O
supports O
it O
, O
and O
- O
to O
make O
things O
easier O
for O
everyone O
- O
to O
create O
an O
RSA O
key O
in O
software O
, O
if O
the O
card O
does O
not O
support O
it O
. O

Subject O
: O
OpenSC O
Security O
Advisory O

admin.php O
in O
Arz O
Development O
The O
Gemini SN
Portal SN
4.7 SV
and SV
earlier SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
authentication O
and O
gain O
administrator O
privileges O
by O
setting O
the O
user O
cookie O
to O
admin O
and O
setting O
the O
name O
parameter O
to O
users O
. O

Bug O
You O
can O
access O
to O
the O
admin O
panel O
altering O
the O
cookie O
and O
adding O
a O
parameter O
in O
the O
navigation O
bar O
. O

It O
is O
perfect O
for O
large O
business O
network O
services O
, O
to O
the O
simple O
personal O
web O
site O
for O
use O
with O
PHP O
and O
MySQL O
. O

Exploit O
Note O
: O
POST O
is O
not O
checked O
and O
you O
can O
enter O
all O
by O
GET O
. O

Many O
of O
the O
built O
in O
pages O
use O
the O
dynamic O
database O
file O
system O
( O
ArzFS O
) O
to O
manipulate O
files O
and O
folders O
. O

< O
/title O
Blogs O
hosted O
on O
BlogSpot.com O
have O
filter O
mechanisms O
for O
their O
input O
; O
however O
, O
they O
will O
allow O
you O
to O
inject O
anything O
within O
comments O
. O

This O
can O
become O
dangerous O
when O
input O
filters O
allow O
html O
tags O
within O
comments O
, O
as O
they O
will O
get O
parsed O
and O
executed O
under O
certain O
circumstances O
. O

Proof O
of O
concept O
: O
Initial O
release O
of O
vulnerability O
: O
p=99 O

Comments O
: O
Jose O
( O
at O
) O
onzra O
( O
dot O
) O
com O
Register O
for O
my O
RSA O
2007 O
Training O
Course O
Creative O
Web O
Protocol O
Attacks O
, O
Beyond O
Web O
Hacking O
February O
4 O
, O
5 O
2007 O
San O
Francisco O

In O
the O
following O
example O
everything O
within O
the O
comment O
, O
in O
theory O
should O
never O
be O
executed O
; O
however O
, O
safari O
decides O
to O
execute O
the O
script O
tag O
. O

Overview O
: O
Safari O
on O
occasions O
may O
improperly O
parse O
the O
source O
of O
an O
HTML O
document O
, O
which O
can O
lead O
to O
the O
execution O
of O
html O
tags O
within O
comments O
. O

Note O
: O
Only O
Safari O
viewers O
will O
be O
affected O
. O

unable O

ESXi SN

A O

Definition O
( O
DTD O
) O
defines O

( O

also O
which O

for O

of O

on O
your O
patch O

history O
. O

A O

could O

to O

( O

BIND O
includes O
a O
DNS O
server O
( O
named O
) O
; O
a O
resolver O
library O
( O
routines O
for O
applications O
to O
use O
when O
interfacing O
with O
DNS O
) O
; O
and O
tools O
for O
verifying O
that O
the O
DNS O
server O
is O
operating O
correctly O
. O

A O
buffer O
overflow O
flaw O
was O
found O
in O
the O
ntpq O
diagnostic O
command O
. O

Multiple O
integer O
overflow O
flaws O
were O
found O
in O
various O
Python O
modules O
. O

Security O
best O
practices O
provided O
by O
VMware O
recommend O
that O
the O
Service O
Console O
be O
isolated O
from O
the O
VM O
network O
. O

Common O
Vulnerabilities O
and O
Exposures O
project O
( O

) O
has O
assigned O
the O
names O
CVE-2008-4307 O
, O
CVE-2009-0834 O
, O
CVE-2009-1337 O
, O
CVE-2009-0787 O
, O
CVE-2009-1336 O
to O
the O
security O
issues O
fixed O
in O
kernel O
2.6.18-128.1.10 O
. O

If O
ntpd O
was O
configured O
to O
use O
public O
key O
cryptography O
for O
NTP O
packet O
authentication O
, O
a O
remote O
attacker O
could O
use O
this O
flaw O
to O
send O
a O
specially-crafted O
request O
packet O
that O
could O
crash O
ntpd O
or O
, O
potentially O
, O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
with O
the O
privileges O
of O
the O
ntp O
user O
. O

An O
integer O
signedness O
error O
, O
leading O
to O
a O
buffer O
overflow O
, O
was O
found O
in O
the O
Python O
zlib O
extension O
module O
. O

Please O
see O
for O
more O
information O
on O
VMware O
security O
best O
practices O
. O

A O
flaw O
was O
found O
in O
the O
way O
BIND O
handles O
dynamic O
update O
message O
packets O
containing O
the O
ANY O
record O
type O
. O

The O
Network O
Time O
Protocol O
( O
NTP O
) O
is O
used O
to O
synchronize O
a O
computer O
time O
with O
a O
referenced O
time O
source O
. O

The O
Service O

present O
in O

is O
affected O
by O
the O
following O
security O
issues O
. O

is O

of O
this O

When O
the O
assert O
( O
) O
system O
call O
was O
disabled O
, O
an O
input O
sanitization O
flaw O
was O
revealed O
in O
the O
Python O
string O
object O
implementation O
that O
led O
to O
a O
buffer O
overflow O
. O

If O
an O
attacker O
is O
able O
to O
get O
a O
carefully-crafted O
certificate O
signed O
by O
a O
Certificate O
Authority O
trusted O
by O
an O
application O
using O
GnuTLS O
, O
the O
attacker O
could O
use O
the O
certificate O
during O
a O
man-in-the-middle O
attack O
and O
potentially O
confuse O
the O
application O
into O
accepting O
it O
by O
mistake O
. O

Solution O
Please O
review O
the O
patch/release O
notes O
for O
your O
product O
and O
version O
and O
verify O
the O
md5sum O
of O
your O
downloaded O
file O
. O

A O
remote O
attacker O
could O
provide O
a O
specially-crafted O
XML O
file O
, O
which O
once O
opened O
by O
a O
local O
, O
unsuspecting O
user O
, O
would O
lead O
to O
denial O
of O
service O
. O

d. O

on O

. O

Under O

read O
state O

memory O

. O

Using O
a O

to O
step O
into O
a O
syscall O
instruction O
may O
corrupt O
the O
virtual O
machine O
register O
context O
. O

This O
corruption O
produces O
unpredictable O
results O
including O
corrupted O
stack O
pointers O
, O
kernel O
bugchecks O
, O
or O
vmware-vmx O
process O
failures O
. O

A O
release O
candidate O
build O
is O
posted O
publicly O
on O
the O
VMware O
beta O
products O
site O
. O

Thanks O
to O
Tavis O
Ormandy O
of O
Google O
for O
identifying O
this O
issue O
. O

from O

state O
( O

run O
state O
( O

machine O

) O
collects O
information O
about O
the O
last O
recorded O
running O
state O
for O
the O
virtual O
machine O
. O

Although O

feature O
is O
enabled O
by O
default O
, O
no O

by O
default O

. O

Sisfo SN
Kampus SN
0.8 SV
- O
Remote O
File O
Inclusion O
Download O

Multiple O
directory O
traversal O
vulnerabilities O
in O
SeleniumServer SN
FTP SN
Server SN
1.0 SV
, O
and SV
possibly SV
earlier SV
, O
allow O
remote O

to O
list O
arbitrary O

in O

( O

( O

( O

( O

( O

( O

) O

in O
phpcards.header.php O

1.3 SV

AEP SN

- O
sgusrdb.idx O
- O
contains O
userid O
status O
, O

, O

Example O
. O

- O
sam O
- O
backup O
of O
SAM O
file O
containing O
password O
hashes O
. O

Under O
unix O
installations O
the O
default O
root O
directory O
of O
smartgate O
is O
/usr/smartgate O
but O
may O
vary O
. O

- O
adm-gw.acl O
- O
admin O
users O
are O
defined O
here O
. O

AEP O
provide O
network O
solutions O
for O
government O
, O
law O
enforcement O
, O
homeland O
security O
, O
public O
safety O
, O
criminal O
intelligence O
and O
much O
more O
. O

+ O
progra~1/v-one/smartgate O
- O
default O
directory O
for O
smartgate O
installation O
. O

Below O
is O
an O
example O
of O
exploit O
being O
used O
to O
retrieve O
the O
SAM O
password O
file O
in O
a O
real O
world O
attack O
. O

prdelka-vs-AEP-smartgate O
Smartgate O
is O
an O
application O
layer O
security O
gateway O
that O
meets O
FIPS O
140-2 O
requirements O
for O
large-scale O
networked O
environments O
for O
IP-based O
Networks O
. O

- O
sweb.acl O
- O
provides O
access O
control O
to O
webserver O
. O

- O
reginfo.dat O
- O
defines O
data O
entry O
fields O
for O
users O
. O

- O
sweb.dny O
- O
denies O
access O
to O
specified O
webservers O
. O

+ O
winnt O
- O
common O
system O
root O
directory O
, O
varies O
. O

- O
sgconf.ini O
- O
dynamic O
information O
on O
the O
smartgate O
server O
including O
CA O
information O
. O

By O
analyzing O
the O
returned O
HTTP O
header O
response O
, O
an O
attacker O
can O
also O
test O
for O
the O
existance O
of O
a O
remote O
directory O
. O

+ O
data O
- O
default O
directory O
for O
data O
files O
. O

A O
vulnerability O
exists O
in O
the O
smartgate O
SSL O
server O
( O
listens O
on O
port O
443 O
by O
default O
) O
which O
may O
allow O
a O
malicious O
user O
to O
download O
arbitrary O
files O
with O
the O
priviledges O
of O
the O
smartgate O
server O
. O

+ O
system32 O
- O
common O
system32 O
directory O
, O
resides O
above O
% O
sysroot O
% O
- O
kernel32.dll O
- O
detailed O
information O
of O
win32 O
version O
installed O
. O

+ O
repair O
- O
contains O
backup O
SAM O
file O
. O

- O
sgate.acl O
- O
access O
control O
for O
secured O
TCP O
services O
. O

Tested O
against O
Smartgate O
V4.3B O
localhost O
0day O
gcc O
prdelka-vs-AEP-smartgate.c O
-o O

0day O

. O

is O
untested O
against O

smartgate O
but O
should O
function O
as O
expected O
with O

( O
char O

) O
. O

NOTE O
